loans.name: Naomi

texts.en: Naomi is 33 years old. She sells foodstuffs and has done this for four years. With the loan, she would like to add more cassava, potatoes, and sweet potatoes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to make more savings for the better future of the business.

loans.use: to buy more bananas, sweet potatoes and cassava to sell.

loans.name: Top Crazy Group

texts.en:
Rowena is the featured borrower for Top Crazy Group. She got together with her other group members in order to take this Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development loan because they have been close friends ever since they moved from the Philippines to Lebanon. They all work as housekeepers for Lebanese families and earn barely enough money to be able to sustain themselves for a single month. 

Rowena is standing on the far left of the picture, wearing a pink t-shirt. She is a 38-year-old, divorced mother of one child, who is still living in the Philippines. The reason she seeks to acquire this loan is to be able to send her child to school and to lower the burden of the school fees. 

Irine, the woman standing on the far right of the picture, is a single 29-year-old woman who is also working as a housekeeper for a Lebanese family. She is seeking the Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development loan in order to help her parents back in the Philippines. 

Finally, the 35-year-old, single woman, Annie Rose, standing in the middle and a housekeeper as well, wishes to acquire the loan in order to pay the school tuition of her only child, living with her parents in the Philippines.

loans.use: to be able to send her child to school.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is age 30. She sells jewelry and beauty products. She has been in the business for the past five years.  

With the loan, she would like to buy more jewelry and beauty products for sale. The profits from the business will be used to buy her home.

loans.use: to buy more jewelry and beauty products for sale.

loans.name: Tanneh

texts.en:
Tanneh is a 38-year-old woman and lives in the West Point area which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is married and has seven children, aged  between 22 and 17. Only one child is in school and two of her children live at home. She describes herself as a hard-working woman.

For the past three years, Tanneh has been running a market-table where she sells rice, oil, pepper, onions, etc. in the local market. She sells six days a week, from 7am to 6pm. She likes her business because of the ways in which customers buy from her. She started this business with money given to her by her husband. Tanneh uses a shard-taxi to get her goods to her business location.

Tanneh is requesting a loan to purchase more inventory for her business. She plans to build a house for her children. She'd like to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia Microfinance Company Limited.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory for her business.

loans.name: Kombah

texts.en:
Kombah is a 32-year-old woman and lives in the West Point area which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is married and has seven children aged  between 9 and 3. They are in school and live at home.

Kombah described herself as a hardworking woman. For the past four years she has been running a market-table where she sells rice, oil, peppers, onions, etc. in the local market. She sells six days a week from 7 AM to 6 PM, and she likes her business because of the way customers buy from her. She started this business with money given to her by her husband. She uses a shared taxi every time to get her goods to her business spot.

Kombah is requesting a loan to purchase more inventory for her business. She plans to build a house for her children.  She would like to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory for her business

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en: Chantal is 41 years old. She has been selling clothes and shoes for five years. She is requesting a loan to buy more shoes and clothes for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and shoes for sale.

loans.name: Victoire

texts.en:
Victoire is 26 years old. She sells used shoes and has been in the business for three years. 

With the loan, she wants to buy more shoes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to renovate the house.

loans.use: to buy more used shoes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy flour and sugar.

loans.name: Thu

texts.en:
Thu was born in 1961. She has a daughter who has got married. Thu is a widow. She and her daughter mill rice to earn a living. Thu earns about 3,500,000 VND per month. She has done this job for 18 years. Her challenge in work is lack of capital to upgrade her milling machines. Her dream is to be able to enlarge her milling workshop. This loan is one of the steps that helps her reach this dream. Thu is a hardworking woman.

She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2009. In the last loan cycle, she borrowed 9,632,000 VND and repaid on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 10,080,000 VND to buy more rice to mill in her workshop.

loans.use: to buy more rice to mill in her workshop.

loans.name: Pola

texts.en:
Pola's previous loan helped her a lot. She was able to stabilize the business.

Pola, 44, now seeks a loan of KES 10,700 (Kenya shillings) to help her buy wheat flour, cooking oil, and firewood. The major challenge she has been facing is her customers not paying their debts in time.

loans.use: To buy wheat flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Pascasie

texts.en: Pascasie  is 27 years old. She sells shoes and has been selling shoes for the past seven years. With the loan, she would like to buy more shoes, and the profits will be used to renovate the house.  Pascasie has benefited from this type of loan as it was the source of capital for stocking the shoes she sells.

loans.use: To buy more sweaters to sell

loans.name: Eutiquia

texts.en:
Eutiquia is a 44-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has four children. The oldest child is 21 while the youngest is 17. She is engaged in a hog raising business. She has been raising pigs for almost four years. She requested a loan of 9,000 PHP to buy feed and repair her pig pen, for the pigs to live in and grow healthy. 

In the future, Eutiquia would like to expand her piggery business to finance her children's college education.

loans.use: to buy feed and repair her pig pen

loans.name: Deddeh

texts.en:
Deddeh is 33 years old and lives in the West Point area, which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is living with her fiancée who is selling charcoal by the bag. Together, they have three children, ages between 18 and 8. The children are in school and live at home. Deddeh describes herself as a hard-working person. 

For the past seven years, Deddeh has been running a shop where she sells sugar, flour, pepper, rice, etc. in the local market. She likes her business because of the ways in which her customers buy from her. She started this business with money given to her by husband. Every day, Deddeh walks to buy her inventories since her shop is close to the local wholesaler. 

Deddeh is requesting a loan to purchase more goods for her business. She plans to buy a piece of land and build a house. She would like to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia Microfinance Company Limited, which enables small business people to increase their business volume.

loans.use: to purchase more goods for her business.

loans.name: Maybele Group

texts.en:
The group Maybele is composed of three Filipino women working as housekeepers for Lebanese families. Emmelie is the group leader and the featured member of this group. She formed the group in order to acquire a group loan from Al Majmoua. Emmelie is the lady standing the middle of the picture. She is a 44-year-old divorced lady, and a mother of three children who are still living in the Philippines. This loan would truly help her with the numerous expenses of her children, especially with tuition. Her monthly salary is barely sufficient to cover her own personal expenses.

Maybel, the lady standing on the far left of the picture, is a 44-year-old divorced mother of two children. She seeks to acquire the loan in order to cover the school fees of her two children. Finally, Helen, the last group member and the lady standing on the right in the picture is a 38 year-old divorced mother as well. The loan would help her send her two children back to school.

loans.use: to cover the school fees of her children

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.en:
People in the villages around where Vladimir has been residing have commented on his personable and hard-working nature. He is married and has two children and all of them reside in a main city in southeastern Albania. Vladimir is in his early fifties and agriculture is the only activity he has been practicing and generating an income from, for almost twenty years now. He plants and sells corn, wheat and potatoes to wholesalers. His region is known for the quality and quantity of such produce. He also plants other veggies in small quantities and sells them at the local market of a nearby city. 

Vladimir is applying for a loan to buy corn seeds this time and this will be his third loan through the same institution. 

Note that Vladimir's photograph was taken in his home's front yard; his business is located far from his home and he was not feeling very well at the time the photograph was taken.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds

loans.name: Estrellita

texts.en:
Estrellita is 44, a married woman with four children who are in school.  She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Estrellita has a general store business in the Philippines; she has been in this business for eleven years. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

Estrellita requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like bath soap, laundry soap, candies, sugar, coffee and other groceries in her general store.

In the future, Estrellita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like bath soap, laundry soap, candies, sugar, coffee and other groceries in her general store.

loans.name: Toan's Group

texts.en:
Toan is 36 years old. She has three children who are learning at secondary school and primary school. She and her husband  weld iron and stainless steel to earn a living. She also raises pigs to earn more money. Her husband earns about 7,000,000 VND and Toan earns about 3,000,000 VND per month. She has done this job for 12 years. Her family’s total earnings are about 10,000,000 VND per month. Her challenges in life and in work are lack of capital to buy materials to do welding and lack of money to raise her children, who are still studying. Her dream is for her children to grow up well, and that she can build a big farm of pigs and her husband can expand her family’s welding workshop. This loan is one of the steps to help her reach this dream. She will buy food for pigs to gain earnings, and will save the profit for her children’s education. Toan is a passionate businesswoman. Her family has an advantage in its place of business. Therefore, she believes she will be successful.
She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2010. In the last loan cycle, she borrowed 9,632,000 VND and repaid on time. In this new loan cycle, she would like to borrow 10,528,000 VND to buy food for pigs.
Other members who are part of Hoi's group include the following: 
	 Van is 33 years old. She has two children. She is a seller. She wants to borrow 6,944,000 VND to sell fruits. 
	 Thanh is 43 years old. She has three children. She is a farmer. She wants to borrow 6,944,000 VND to buy food for chickens.
	 Hien is 33 years old. She has three children. She is a carpenter. She wants to borrow 9,632,000 VND to buy wood for her carpentry workshop.
 Vien is 32 years old. She has two children. She sells chicken’ eggs. She wants to borrow 6,944,000 VND to buy food for chickens.
 Hong is 31 years old. She has four children. She is a farmer. She wants to borrow 6,944,000 VND to buy food for chickens.

loans.use: to buy food for pigs.

loans.name: Shahnez

texts.en:
Shahnez is 39 years old and single. She is living with her family in the northern part of Kosovo. For more than two years now she has been working in a shop, selling tools for motor cars.  She is very a hard worker.  Shahnez has gained and retained many customers, allowing her business to continue to grow.  

She serves all different people from the various communities of Kosovo. At this time she is in need of a loan to purchase tools for car repairs. This loan will help her to generate more income. Shahnez hopes to save money for her future, as her goal is to get married and have her own family. Shahnez appreciates all of the Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To purchase tools for car repairs

loans.name: Al-Qwa Group

texts.en:
Al-Qwa is a group which consists of three ladies who live together in Hadramout, Yemen. They are hardworking women and applied for a loan of 180,000 YER from AMB. Jamila is a 50-year-old married woman with six children. She is the leader of the group. She is illiterate and works hard to bring up her children. 

Jamila started selling clothes door-to-door. She feels tired when she does the laundry by hand because she doesn’t have enough money to buy a washing machine; therefore, she applied for a loan of 60,000 YER from AMB. She hopes to improve her living conditions to  have better future.

loans.use: to buy a washing machine.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is 33 years old and married with two children. With one child currently in school, Conchita works very hard to provide for them.

Conchita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

Conchita has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as noodles, spices, coffee, laundry soap, sugar, etc. 

Conchita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Mohamed, 22, lives in Kongowea, Kenya. He is single. He is in motorbike transport. This is what he has been doing for one and a half years now.

Mohamed heard of Milango from a friend and he seeks a loan of 21,050 Kenya shillings to purchase a motorbike. In five years he wants to have five motorbikes and employ fellow youth. The major challenge for him in his business is the competition.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Yasmeen's Group

texts.en:
Yasmeen, a member of two person group, is a 34-year-old housewife. She lives with her husband and five children in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. 

Since 2010, her husband has been running a general store, and he works very hard to meet his family's needs. He needs additional capital for the growth of his business, as the demands of his clients are increasing day by day. 

Therefore his wife, Yasmeen, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband's store. He will purchase a variety of products including flour, milk packs, eggs, pulses (edible beans), detergents, oils, etc. to cope with the increased demand of clients. 

Mrs. Yasmeen  and her husband are very hopeful that the loan will be a lucky and productive one for their family.

loans.use: To purchase items for her husband's general store.

loans.name: Innocenta

texts.en:
Innocenta lives in Mombasa, Kenya. She is married and blessed with three children. 

Innocenta sells both new and second-hand clothing; she also receives rent income from tenants. She also sells herbal medicine.

Innocenta learned about Milango through friends, and she is seeking a loan of 53,250 Kenya shillings to buy more clothing to sell.  

She wants her family to have a better life in the future.

loans.use: To purchase clothes to sell.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is 35 years old and lives in the West Point area, which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is living with her fiancée who is a not working now.  Together, they have six children between the ages of 21 and 4. Only three of the children are in school and live at home. Patricia describes herself as a hard-working person.  

Patricia completed tenth grade. Due to a lack of home needs, she decided to establish a business to help support her home. For the past three years, Patricia has been going out of town to buy palm oil to resell in Monrovia. She likes her business because of the ways in which customers buy from her. She started her business with money given to her by her friends. Patricia uses the bus to get her goods to her location.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil for her business. She plans to buy a piece of land and to build a house. She would like to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia Microfinance Company Limited, which enables small business people to increase their business volume.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Nozimakhon

texts.ru: Нозимахон незамужняя молодая девушка. Ей 21 год. Она вместе с родителями проживает в городе Турсунзаде.  Нозимахон очень способная и предприимчивая девушка. Она после окончания школы научилась кройке и шитью и у себя дома занимается вышиванием женских национальных платьев. Нозимахон несмотря на свой юный возраст занимается двум видом деятельности. Одновременно она вместе с матерью занимается растениеводством. У них при дворе дома имеется небольшой участок земли, на котором они выращивают овощи, в частности помидор огурцы и т.д. Нозимахон занята в этих сферах деятельности уже 3 года. Кредит берет для посева овощей и для приобретения швейной машинки. В будущем за счет полученного дохода Нозимахон планирует открыть ателье.
texts.en: Nozimakhon is a young single woman.  She is 21 years old.  She lives together with her parents in the city of Tursun-zoda.  Nozimakhon is a very capable and entrepreneurial young woman.  After graduating from school, she learned how to sew and is now involved in embroidering women's national dresses.  Despite her young age, Nozimakhon is involved in two types of businesses.  Concurrently, she and her mother are involved in agriculture.  They have a small plot of land by their house, where they grow vegetables, such as tomatoes, cucumbers, etc.  Nozimakhon has been involved in these businesses for three years.  She is requesting this loan to plant vegetables and to purchase a sewing machine.  In the future, she wants to use her profits to open an atelier.

loans.use: to plant vegetables and to purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Naheeda's Group

texts.en:
Naheeda is a 35-year-old woman living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her spouse and  three children. Since 2005, her husband has been running a small vegetable shop. This is the only source of income for their family. Due to the increase in customer demand, Naheeda has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan as a member of two-person group. She will use the loan for the expansion of her husband's shop. With the loan, her husband can buy a variety of fresh vegetables that will allow him to offer more varieties to his clients and increase his sales and income. He would also build one more room to add some more space to his shop. Her husband is a very hard-working and honest man and is confident about his family’s bright future.
NOTE: In the picture Naheeda is raising her hand

loans.use: To purchase fresh vegetables

loans.name: Nimer

texts.en: Nimer is a 56-year-old married man living in a small village in Lebanon. The highest education he ever got was elementary school because his parents could not afford more than that, causing a great handicap throughout his life. He lives with his wife and his two children who are under 18. His wife works in the farms next to their house from sunrise till dusk. Nimer was previously working as a blacksmith, but his advancing age and his deteriorating health condition forced him to resign and to look for another means of earning income. This is how he ended up selling coffee and tea from a mobile machine, which he moves every day from one corner of the village to the other. He asked for Al Majmoua to provide a loan that would enable him to buy a new coffee maker machine that would facilitate his work. His ambition for the future is to open up his own coffee store so that he would not have to move around the village.

loans.use: buy a new coffee maker machine

loans.name: Haseena

texts.en: A loan of 15000 PKR would help Haseena to get a new tailoring machine as the old one is not working properly. She has been doing tailoring work for three years and she has a very well satisfied client base. With the profit, Haseena would pay the rent of her house. She is very thankful to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a new tailoring machine

loans.name: Elinah

texts.en:
Elinah lives in Mombasa, Kenya. She is married and for three years now she has been running her own tailoring shop. She learned of Milango Financial through a friend. She now seeks a loan of 21,000 Kenya shillings to purchase tailoring material. She really wants to employ other young people who cannot find formal jobs. That is her plan in five years.
The major challenge in her business is the late payment she receives from her clients and also it’s difficult to find clients.
Income raised from this loan will be helpful in paying school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy tailoring material.

loans.name: Isata

texts.en: Isata is a 40-year-old woman and lives in the West Point area which is the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is married, and has three children between the ages of 16 and 25. Only one is in school and two of her children live at home. She describes herself as a hard-working woman. For the past eight months, she has been running a shop where she sells charcoal in the local market. She sells six days a week from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m.. She likes her business which she started with money given to her by husband. She is requesting a loan to purchase more inventory for her business. She plans to build a house for her children. She thanks the lenders who support BRAC Liberia

loans.use: to purchase more inventory for her business,

loans.name: Sokhorn

texts.en: Sokhorn was born and raised in Takeo province, where silk weaving is the most popular business. Today, she is the mother of three children, all of whom are still in school. For the last five years she has struggled to earn a living by weaving silk, and earns about $8 a day. She is applying for her first loan from Kiva's partner VisionFund to pay for the tuition of one of her children, who is studying in a local university to get a degree in accounting. She hopes that her daughter will do well at school and get a good job after graduation.

loans.use: to pay for daughter's tuition.

loans.name: Freddy Orlando

texts.es:
El cliente Freddy vive en Guayaquil, el es un hombre emprendedor por eso el comenzó hace algunos años su negocio de zapateria. Ya que cuando se quedo sin trabajo tubo que iniciar una actividad económica para generar ingresos para su familia. 

Poco a poco fue mejorando su negocio hasta el momento que tiene un negocio donde hace zapatos de todo tipo. Para hacer los zapatos el necesita cuero, materiales de pegamento, suelas etc. Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio ya que tiene aun tres hijos pequeños. 

Por eso el quiere el préstamo para comprar materiales para los zapatos y hacer en mas volumen y asi poder vender a mas clientes mas zapatos. Quiere específicamente comprar suelas, pegamento, pasadores.
texts.en:
Freddy lives in Guayaquil, and he is an enterprising man.  He started his business of making shoes a few years ago.  When he was left without work, he had to start a business activity in order to generate income for his family.

His business improved little by little.  He now has a business where he makes all types of shoes.  In order to make the shoes he needs leather, glue, and soles, etc.  He has a lot of aspirations with his business because he has three children who are still little.

Therefore, he wants the loan to buy materials for shoes and to make a greater volume.  This way he will be able to sell more shoes to more customers.  Specifically, he wants to buy soles, glue, and shoelaces.

loans.use: to buy soles, glue, and shoelaces.

loans.name: Fortaleza Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FORTALEZA” iniciará el décimo octavo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Lucia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: macramé de mantas, tejido de mallas, tejido de chompas, venta de ropa, venta de fundas de guitarra, costura, venta de salchipapap, tejido de mantas, transporte, venta de verduras, tejido de awayos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Lucia es integrante, ella indica que hace ocho años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución que la visito en su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de taller de costura; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió por la experiencia que adquirió su esposo en otros talleres.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra tela) que adquirirá de las tiendas, por mayor, y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los ahorros.
texts.en:
The “Fortaleza” [Fortitude] Communal Bank will begin its eighteenth loan cycle with Pro Mujer, and they are working with the organization’s regional office in Los Andes.  The group is comprised of nine members and is headed by a board of directors where Lucia is president. The members of the communal bank are engaged in varied businesses including sales of macramé blankets, lace fabric, knitted sweaters, clothing, guitar cases, “salchipapas” [pan fried sausage and French fries], knitted blankets, vegetables, and knitted “aguayos” [a rectangular piece of patterned cloth, used in traditional South American communities to carry children, goods, etc.] as well as service businesses such as sewing, and transportation.

The loan they are requesting will benefit women, such as Lucia, who own small businesses.   She states that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for eight years and joined at the invitation of one of the organization’s promoters that visited her in her home.  Currently, she has a sewing workshop.  She relates that her husband acquired experience in other workshops and this is how she learned the business.  

The loan she is taking out now is for the purpose of increasing capital to purchase fabric that she will acquire wholesale from stores, and subsequently, market in her retail space.  This type of work allows her to generate income for her household in the best possible way as she is married and has four children.  When she was asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she enjoyed the savings.

loans.use: to purchase fabric.

loans.name: La Estrella Y El Lucero Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres socias de éxitos una de ellas es Mariela mujer de 23 años de edad, casada, con un hijo menor, su negocio es la venta de ropa usada ambulante en los diferentes barrios de Masaya, tiene dos años y medios de tener su negocio anteriormente era ama de casa, también comercializa en las comunidades rurales cercanas, este crédito lo invertirá en la compra de ropa usada pantalón de varón, pantalón de dama, blusas de dama, ropa de niños, faldas de damas, camisetas de varón etc. Tania tiene 27 años de edad su negocio es la venta de sopas los fines de semana y Ericka tiene 25 años de edad su negocio es la venta de ropa nueva y usada.
texts.en:
This group is composed of 3 members, one of whom is Mariela, a 23-year-old married woman with a minor child. Her business is selling used clothing on the streets in different sections of Masaya and also in nearby rural communities. She has been in this business for 2 ½ years. Previously, she was a housewife.

The loan will be invested in purchasing used clothing, including men's pants and T-shirts, women's pants, blouses, and skirts, and children's clothes, etc.

The other 2 members are Tania, 27 years old, who sells soups on weekends, and Ericka, 25-years-old, who sells new and used clothing.

loans.use: to purchase used clothing to sell, such as men's pants, shirts and T-shirts, and women's pants, blouses, and skirts, and children's clothes, etc.

loans.name: Abida

texts.en: Abida is 38 years old and a hard-working housewife who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her husband and two daughters. Her husband is a janitor by profession but his monthly income is not enough to pay all of the family's household expenses. To supplement his income, he has worked as a taxi driver at night for the last five years. Currently, he is not able to do this job because his taxi needs to be repaired. Abida has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to pay for the cost of repairs. With the profit her husband earns from driving a taxi, he wants to open a new auto mechanic shop in the future. Abida wants to provide quality education to her of all children and prays for the good health of her family and the growth of her husband's business. She is very thankful to BRAC Pakistan and Kiva for their support.

loans.use: to pay for the repair of a taxi.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a single 34-year-old living in the West Point area, which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. Grace, who was unable to go to school, describes herself as a hardworking woman.

For the past four years Grace has been selling slippers six days a week in the local market, from 7 a.m. to 5 p.m., a business she started with money given to her by her mother. She uses a shared taxi to get her goods to her business spot.

Now requesting a loan to purchase more slippers to sell, Grace plans to build a house for her children. She would like to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more slippers for her business

loans.name: Mabinty

texts.en: Mabinty is 25 years old and lives in Tombo, which is a rural area west of Freetown. She is single and has one child who is two years old. In 2010, she went into the business of selling plastic bowls. She began her business to help her family live a better life. She works for 10 hours a day, 7 days a week and says that her main challenge is inflation. She is requesting a loan to buy more bowls to sell to her customers. She hopes that the extra income she earns from this loan will allow her to buy a piece of land. Her goal for the future is to expand her business and she is very grateful for the support she receives from Kiva and BRAC Sierra Leone.

loans.use: to buy a variety of plastic bowls to sell.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en: Isatu is 25 years old and lives in the town of Tombo. She is single and the mother of one child who is two years old. In 2010, she went into the business of selling items made of plastic. She began her business because she wanted to create a reliable source of income to use to care for her child and herself. She works at her business from 8:00 a.m. until 9:00 p.m. The main challenge she faces in her business is an occasional item that breaks. She is requesting a loan to buy more bowls to sell. She hopes that the extra income she earns from this loan will allow her to make repayments and expand her business. In the future, her goal is to own the biggest shop in the community. She thanks Kiva and BRAC Sierra Leone for their support.

loans.use: to buy more bowls to sell.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is married and lives in Kaloleni near Mariakani, Kenya.  She operates her own retail shop selling items such as rice, flour, sugar, and cooking oil. She started her business from her own savings. 

Mariam is requesting a loan from Milango for 21,050 KES, which she will use to purchase soap, cooking oil, rice, and maize flour to sell. She hopes to have a wholesale shop in five years. Income from the loan will go to her savings account.

loans.use: to purchase soap, cooking oil, rice, and maize flour.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: For the last 10 years, Richard has earned a living by raising hogs for sale. He also grows rice on his one-hectare farm. He is 42 years old and blessed with four children, three of whom attend school. He and his wife would like to give their children a quality education so they can live a better life. To make this possible, he is requesting a loan for PHP 20,000 to buy livestock supplies such as feed and vitamins. In the future, he hopes to have more pigs to raise so that he can continue to improve his financial stability and let his three children finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy livestock supplies such as feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 45 years old, married, and has three children who attend school. She lives in West Point, which has the most populated market in Montserrado County.  For the past four years she has been selling rice, cola, sugar, oil, etc. in the local market. She works six days a week from 7 AM to 6 PM. Mary  started this business with money given to her by husband. She uses share-taxi to get her goods at her business area.  

Mary is requesting a loan from BRAC Liberia, which she will use to purchase more inventory for her business. She plans is to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory for her business

loans.name: Mbamoussa's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été créé depuis mai 2011.Il est composé de membres qui sont issus de la même zone.
Celle qui est habillée en blanc sur la photo,est la responsable du groupe,elle est mariée et âgée de 23 ans.
Son activité consiste à acheter des fruits et les revendre.

Elle dipose d'une bonne expérience pour ce type d'activité,elle a commencé à faire du commerce de fruits depuis l'âge de 15 ans.

Avec ce prêt,elle compte acheter de la banane pour une valeur de 35 000f et le revendre.

Son objectif est d'aider son mari dans la prise en charge de certaines dépenses comme la nourriture et les frais de santé de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This group was created in May 2011. It is composed of members from the same area. In the photo, the one dressed in white is the group's official. She is married and 23 years old. Her business involves purchasing fruit to resell.

She has good experience in this type of business. She started doing commerce in fruit at 15 years of age. 

With this loan, she intends to purchase bananas for 35,000 francs to resell. Her goal is to help out her husband in covering certain expenses, such as food and the cost of health care for the children.

loans.use: to purchase bananas to resell

loans.name: Fatoumata's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été créé en mai 2011.IL est composé de membres qui sont issus de la même localité.Elles ont comme activité le petit commerce.

Celle qui se trouve à l'extrême droite sur la photo et levant le bras est la responsable du groupe,elle est mariée et âgée de 46ans.

Son activité consiste à acheter de la marchandise telle que des vêtements,des chaussures.

Son objectif est d'augmenter son épargne et contribuer dans la prise en charge des frais de sa famille en assurant les dépenses de scolarité de ses enfants
texts.en:
This group was created in May 2011. It is composed of members from the same town. Their work involves small-scale commerce.

In the photo, the one at the far right with her arm raised is the group's official. She is married and 46 years old.

Her business involves purchasing merchandise, such as clothing and shoes. Her goal is to increase her savings and help cover family expenses by cover her children's schooling costs.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise to resell

loans.name: Astou's Group

texts.fr:
Créé le 04 Juillet 2002 à l’inauguration du banc villageois, ce groupe est composé de femmes qui ont une expérience dans le programme des bancs villageois. Elles sont toutes issues du même village et partageant des liens forts de solidarité et d’entre aide. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Astou (en médaillon en haut), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée, est âgée de 56 ans et mère de deux enfants : un garçon et une fille. Son activité consiste à acheter des sacs d’arachide pour la transformation en patte conditionnés dans des seaux de 5 et 20 litres destiné à la vente dans les marchés hebdomadaires.

Avec son nouveau crédit, elle prévoit d’acheter dix sacs d’arachide à 13 000 F CFA le sac, moyennant de frais de transformation 15000 F CFA. Avec des bénéfices prévisionnels d’au moins 30 000 F CFA tous les 15 jours.

Les bénéfices, elle compte les utiliser pour appuyer son mari dans la  scolarisation de ses  deux enfants
texts.en:
Created on July 4, 2002 at the inauguration of the 'banc villageois', this group is composed of women with experience in the 'banc villageois' program. The women are all from the same village and share strong ties of solidarity and mutual assistance. Their main work involves small-scale commerce.

Ms. Astou (appearing in the cameo in the photo) is the featured borrower of the group. She is married, 56 years old, and a mother of two children: a boy and a girl. Her business involves purchasing sacks of peanuts to process into prepared peanut butter in buckets of 5 and 20 liters. This product is sold at the weekly markets.

With her new loan, she plans on purchasing 10 sacks of peanuts at 13,000 francs CFA each sack and to pay to process them for 15,000 francs. The planned profits would be at least 30,000 francs every two week.

With the profits, she plans on supporting her husband to cover the schooling costs for her two children.

loans.use: to purchase peanuts and to pay for processing

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La cliente vive en Guayaquil, es una mujer emprendedora ya que desde hace 10 años comenzó su negocio de venta de mariscos. Poco a poco siguió con su negocio ya que tiene 2 hijos que dependen de ella ya que esta separada del padre de ellos. 

En la actualidad trabaja desde las 06:00 am hasta las 15h00 pm todos los días. Su dificultad en su negocio es una discapacidad intelectual que tiene y eso hace que no trabaje al 100%, pero ella ha podido trabajar con mucho esfuerzo para darle lo mejor a sus hijos. Vende pescados y mariscos en un puesto. 

Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere comprar con el préstamo pescados, mariscos para vender a mas clientela y así tener mas ingresos. En el futuro quiere hacer su casa de cemento.
texts.en:
The client lives in Guayaquil. She is enterprising woman, as 10 years ago she started her business selling seafood. Little by little she has continued with her business. She has two children who depend on her, as she is separated from their father. 

Currently she works from 6 a.m. until 3 p.m. every day. Her difficulty in her business is the intellectual disability she has, and that makes it so she doesn't work at 100%. But she has been able to work with a great deal of effort to do her best for her children. 

She sells fish and seafood at a stall. She has many hopes and ambitions for her business, and that is why she wants to use the loan to buy fish and seafood to sell to more customers, and this way have more income. In the future she wants to build her home from cement.

loans.use: To buy fish and seafood.

loans.name: Oretha

texts.en:
Oretha is 38 years old and lives in the West Point area which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is a single mother of three children ages 19, 13, and 6, all of whom live at home, but only two of them are presently in school.

Unable to go to school herself, Oretha describes herself as a hardworking woman who for the past two years has been selling soft drinks in the local market. Working six days a week from 9 a.m. to 6 p.m., she started this business with money given to her by mother, and uses a shared taxi to transport her goods to her business spot.

Oretha is requesting this loan to purchase more soft drinks for her business, and she plans to build a house for her children. She thanks the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks for her business

loans.name: Bolivia Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “BOLIVIA”  iniciará el quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por once  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Lucila es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tienda de barrio, transportistas, venta y costura de mandiles, venta de cosméticos, venta de verduras, venta de masitas, tejido de mantas, venta de camas, venta de calzados, venta de pasteles.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Lucila es integrante, ella indica que hace cinco ciclos que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de sus amigas de grupo que son socias de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió por iniciativa propia.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de arroz, azúcar, fideo, etc.) que adquirirá de las tiendas mayoristas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto fijo. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia ya que ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.
 
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito, el área de salud y las capacitaciones.
texts.en:
The "Bolivia" communal bank will start its fifth loan cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the Senkata regional office. It is made up of 11 members and led by a board of directors of which Lucy is the chair.

The businesses that the members of the communal bank carry on are varied and include: neighborhood store, drivers, sewing and sale of aprons, sale of cosmetics, sale of vegetables, sale of pastries, weaving shawls, sale of beds, sale of footwear, and sale of cakes. 

The loan they will take out is to benefit small business owners such as Lucila. She says that she joined Pro Mujer five loan cycles ago, at the invitation of her friends who are members of the institution. 

Currently she has a neighborhood store business. She says that she launched this business through her own initiative. The loan she will take it now is to increase her working capital (purchase of rice, sugar, noodles, etc.) which she will acquire at the wholesale stores in the city of La Paz, and later sell at her permanent stand. This form of work allows her to generate income for supporting her family, as she is married and has two children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the credit, the health clinic, and the training workshops.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Angelino

texts.es: Angelino, de 45 años es un hombre ejemplar. Su vida la dedicó a su madre de 68 años a la que cuida con mucho amor, en su casa propia.Sus extensas áreas de terreno agrícola, lo motivaron a dedicar su vida a este negocio. Sus padres desde pequeño le enseñaron a cuidar la tierra y saber producirla. Comenta que gracias a su educación hoy en día es uno de los mejores agricultores de su pueblo. Siembra cada 4 meses: alverja, habas y manzanilla. Los cuales vende en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad, hasta donde se traslada con frecuencia. Ahora desea mejorar sus sembríos para obtener más ganancias.Este es el primer crédito con KIVA y agradece el apoyo recibido, ya que le ayuda a invertir en sus sembríos. Promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, pues le gusta ser honesto y responsable.Angelino, invertirá los S/.1000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Angelino, age 45, is an exemplary man.  He dedicated his life to his 68 year old mother, whom he cares for with much love in his own house.

His extensive farmland motivated him to devote his life to this business.  When he was little, his parents taught him how to care for the land and make it productive.  He states that, thanks to his education, he is now one of the best farmers in his village.

Every four months he plants peas, beans, and chamomile.  He sells them at the city wholesale market, where he frequently travels.  He now wishes to improve his crops in order to get more earnings.

This is his first loan with Kiva, and he is grateful for the support he has received.  It helps him to invest in his crops.  He pledges to be punctual with his payments.  He likes be honest and responsible.  Angelino will use the 1,000 soles to buy organic fertilizer to nourish his fields.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Rezan's Group

texts.en:
Rezan is 32 years old, married, and has two children. With limited career options due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, Rezan is one of the many Iraqi woman who is working from home, using her sewing skills to generate income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family.

Rezan has four years of experience with her small, home-based sewing and tailoring business. She has been able to attract clients with quality works on dresses for women and children as well as on small fabric household items. In addition to continuing producing quality works, she would like to improve her work environment, making it both nicer for herself as she works and for her clients as they visit for fittings. Rezan is requesting a loan from Relief International Microfinance Iraq, which she will use to renovate her work area. 

Relief International - Microfinance Iraq offers group loans for clients unable to provide a guarantor and unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of three to five clients and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group. 

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about this borrower has been altered for their protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to renovate her work area

loans.name: Unidas Por Siempre Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “UNIDADAS POR SIEMPRE”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Copacabana, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Basilia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, tejido, venta de tucumanas, venta de salchipapa, venta de leche, venta de comida.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Basilia es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de un promotor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años por el concejo familiar.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para la renovación de herramientas (compra de ollas) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la lo instalará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The "Unidas por Siempre" communal bank will start its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Copacabana regional office. It is made up of eight members and led by a board of directors, of which Basilia is the chair. 

The businesses that the members of the communal bank carry on are varied, and include: weaving, sale of empanadas, sale of salchipapas (fast food made with potatoes and hot dogs), sale of milk, and sale of food. 

The loan they will take out is to benefit small business owners such as Basilia. She states that this is the first time she has belonged to Pro Mujer, joining at the invitation of a field representative of the institution, who came to visit her at her home. 

Currently she has a business selling food, and says that she learned this business several years ago with advice from her family. The loan she will take out now is to update her equipment (purchase of pots), which she will acquire in the markets in the city of El Alto, and later install in her cooking area.  

This form of work allows her to generate income to support her household as best she can, as she is married and has two children. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the health workshops and the credit.

loans.use: Compra de olla

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase ten goats to sell.

loans.name: Crisley

texts.es:
Crisley es una joven estudiante universitaria de medicina, quien esta solicitando un préstamo educativo para poder pagar la matricula de sus estudios. Esta es su historia:

Mi nombre es Crisley y soy una joven mujer estudiante de medicina en Santo Domingo. Unos 3 años atrás verme estudiando parecía un lejano sueño, debido a una circunstancia que cambió mi vida y la de mi familia. Fui diagnosticada en el 2009 con una enfermedad cronica. Tenía múltiples internamientos y pasé un poco más de 6 meses hospitalizada interrumpidamente, y al final tenía una cirugía. A pesar de unas pocas limitaciones, mi condición no me ha paralizado en absoluto. Voy a la universidad, pertenezco al grupo de danza, soy voluntaria en la cruz roja y cada que puedo brindo mi apoyo moral a otras personas como yo. 

Tengo muy claro mi propósito en la vida y las metas que deseo alcanzar. Esto incluye convertirme en una gran doctora. Creo fielmente en que todo en la vida pasa por una razón, y quizás esto  fue solo el empuje que necesitaba para saber que mi lugar está donde pueda servir, ayudar y hacer de mi experiencia algo positivo en la vida de alguien más que tiene problemas de salud similares a los míos. 

Vivo con mis padres y un hermano que estudia en la escuela secundaria. Todo el proceso que he narrado implicó un gasto excesivo para mi familia. Todavía necesito  materiales, medicinas, y chequeos médicos para mi condición. La condición financiera de la familia ya no soporta los gastos de mi educación universitaria. Es por ello que apelo de su ayuda en la manera de lo posible para encontrar una forma de costear mis estudios. Terminar mi carrera exitosamente y graduarme con honores es un sueño más que deseo ver cumplido, con la ayuda de Dios y mientras haya vida en mí seguiré luchando hasta verlo alcanzado.
texts.en:
Crisley is a young medical school student, who is requesting an education loan to pay her school's tuition.  This is her story:

My name is Crisley and I am a young medical student in Santo Domingo. Three years ago it seemed like a distant dream to study one day due to the circumstances that changed my life and that of my family. I was diagnosed in 2009 with a chronic disease. I was admitted to the hospital several times and I was hospitalized for more than six months followed by surgery. Despite a few limitations, my condition has not stopped me completely. I attend university, I am part of a dance group, I volunteer with the Red Cross, and whenever I can I provide moral support for other people like me. 

I am very clear on my purpose in life and the goals I want to achieve. This includes becoming a great doctor of gastroenterology. I truly believe that everything in life happens for a reason and maybe this was all just the push I needed to know that my place is where I can serve, help, and turn my experiences into something positive in the life of another that has health problems similar to mine. 

I live with my parents and brother who is in secondary school. The entire process I just explained was excessively costly for my family. I still need things, medicines, and medical visits due to my condition. My family's financial situation can no longer support my university expenses. That is why I am requesting help in whatever manner possible to find a way to pay for my studies. Successfully completing my degree and graduating with honors is another dream I hope to achieve with the help of God. While there is still life in me I will continue striving to reach it.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition to study medicine

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 45-year-old Kadiatu from Tombo Western rural area. She is married with three children. 

Kadiatu runs a clothing business; she sells blouses within her community. She has been running this business since 2001. She works at the business 10 hours per day and 7 days per week.   Kadiatu says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand her business.

Kadiatu has requested a loan in order to purchase more blouses for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her family's standard of living and increase her business. In the future, she plans to open a big clothing shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more blouses for resale

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia is a hog raiser within her local community. She has been running this kind of business for ten years. She is glad because through her hard work and with the help of her spouse, she has been able to maintain her hog raising business. Cynthia is happily married and blessed with two children.

Cynthia aims to have a viable source of income someday so she can improve her living conditions and educate her grandchild. The couple have been doing their best in order to obtain greater profit. But at this time, Cynthia is in need of additional capital amounting to PHP 5,000 which will allow her to buy necessary feed and vitamins for her hogs.She knows that through sustaining her hogs with proper nutrition, she can fulfill her dreams and goals in life. She is hoping that lenders will approve her requested loan amount.

loans.use: to buy necessary feed and vitamins for her hogs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to fund the lease for a 12-foot by 12-foot display to market her business.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: Luis es un señor de 48 años de edad, dedicado desde  hace varios años  a la siembra y cosecha de café, es un hombre muy trabajador y emprendedor. Con su trabajo ha ayudado a que la condición de vida de su familia haya mejorado considerablemente, solicita un crédito de un millón de colones (¢1.000.000) para comprar almácigo de café (plantas pequeñas en desarrollo)insumos agrícolas como plaguicidas, herbicidas, abonos y otros. Con este crédito pretende mejorar la calidad del producto y por supuestos sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en: Luis is 48 years old and, for a number of years, has been making a living sowing and harvesting coffee.  He is very hard-working and enterprising and, with his work, his family's living conditions have improved considerably.  Luis is applying for a loan of one million colons in order to buy coffee seedlings (small plants), and agricultural supplies such as pest-control substances, herbicides and manure.  Luis plans to use this loan to improve the quality of his product and, of course, his income.

loans.use: to buy coffee seedlings and fertiliser

loans.name: Abdusamad

texts.ru: Абдусамад добродушный человек. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Он очень трудолюбивый человек и имеет более чем 7 лет опыта в бизнесе. Он занимается купле продажей индустриальных товаров в магазине, который находится в центре села. Каждый день его магазин посещают много народа, и он должен расширить ассортимент своего товара. Его жена помогает ему введения бизнеса. Абдусамад хочет увеличить оборотный капитал и поэтому он запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 долларов США. Он надеется на вас и на вашу доброту.
texts.en: Abdusamad is a good-natured man.  He is married and has two children.  He is hardworking and has more than seven years of business experience.  He sells industrial goods at a store that is located in the center of town.  Each day, many people visit his store and he needs to expand the assortment of goods he offers.  His wife helps him conduct his business.  Abdusamad wants to increase his working capital so he is asking for a loan of 2,000 USD.  He relies on you and your kindness.

loans.use: To buy home product to increase working capital

loans.name: Aly

texts.ru: Али человек, который внес большой вклад в системе образования таджикского народа. Он педагог и работает учителем в средней школе. Он чистосердечно выполняет свою работу. Али 50 лет.  Он женат и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Али очень трудолюбивый человек и поэтому он работает в нескольких местах. Кроме того, что он работает учителем в средней школе, он занимается скотоводством и в свободное время занимается предоставлением услуги такси. Али старается, чтобы обеспечить семью с хорошим условием проживания. Он уже несколько лет планирует отремонтировать свой дом, но не может, так как он не имеет достаточно денег. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 долларов США для покупки строительных материалов для ремонта дома.  Он ждет вашу доброту и как добросовестный человек обещает погасить займ во время.
texts.en: Aly has made great contributions to the education system of the Tajik people.  He works as a teacher at a high school and earnestly fulfills his duties.  Aly is 50 years old, married and has three children.  He is a hardworking person and has a few different jobs.  Besides his teaching position at the high school, he breeds cattle and drives a taxi in his free time.  Aly tries to provide his family with a good life.  He has been planning to make repairs to his home for a few years but hasn't been able to due to a lack of funds.  He is asking for a loan of 1,000 USD to buy building materials for the renovations.  He awaits your kindness and assures that, as a conscientious person, he will repay the loan in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy building materials to make home repairs

loans.name: Taya

texts.en:
Taya is 40 years old and lives in the West Point area, which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is married; her husband sells water by the sack. They have three children, ages 20, 16, and 8, only two are in school and live at home. Taya describes herself as a hard-working person.  

For the past three years, Taya has been running a shop where she sells rice and soup in the local market. She likes her business because of the ways in which her customers buy from her. She started this business with money given to her by her husband. Every day, Taya walks to buy her ingredients since her shop is close to the local market. 

Taya is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, pepper, fish, vita, dried bush meat, onions, coal, etc. for her business. She plans to buy a piece of land and to build a house. She would like to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia Microfinance Company Limited, which enables small business people to increase their business volume.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, pepper, fish, vita, dried bush meat, onions, coal, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Dorah

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 50-year-old Dorah from Waterloo eastern area in Freetown. She is married with six children between the ages of 18 years and 35 years old. One of her children attends school. She started business to earn a daily income for her family.
 
Dorah runs a cookery business; she sells cooked food at her house. She has been running this business since 2004. She works at the business from 5:00 am to 4:00 pm, every day.   Dorah says that the main challenge to her business is the problem of price control in the market.

Dorah has requested a loan in order to buy foods like cooking seasonings, oil and rice. The extra income from this loan will allow her to improve the life of her children. In the future, she plans to have a big restaurant. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy foods like cooking seasonings, oil and rice.

loans.name: Kazungu

texts.en:
Kazungu lives in Mariakani, Kenya. He is married and operates a butchery shop. He started his business one year ago and it is doing fine.

He learned about Milango through friends. He seeks a loan of 26,300 Kenya shillings to buy meat, tomatoes and onions. He is planning to buy a motorbike for easy transportation of the goods to the market place. Weather conditions mostly are the challenge that he faces.

loans.use: To buy meat, tomatoes and onions

loans.name: Adamasay

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 27-year-old Adamasay from Waterloo eastern area in Freetown. She is married with three children between the ages of 11 months and 8 years. One of her children is attending school. She started business to get earn daily income for her family.
 
Adamasay runs a food stand business; she sells cooking seasonings, palm oil and peppers. She has been running this business since 2010. She works at the business 10 hours per day and 7 days per week.  Adamasay says that the main challenge to her business is the problem of price control in the market.

Adamasay has requested a loan in order to buy foods for resale like cooking seasonings, palm oil and rice. The extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her living conditions. In the future, she plans to expand her business more than ever. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy foods like cooking seasonings, palm oil and rice.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort is 19 years old and lives in the West Point area, which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is single and has a two-year-old child. Comfort describes herself as a hard-working woman.

For the past three years, she has been running a shop where she sells pepper, oil, vita, etc. in the local market. She sells six days a week, from 7am to 4pm. She likes her business because of the ways in which her customers buy from her. She started this business with money given to her by her mother. Comfort uses a taxi to get her goods to her business shop.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more goods for her business. She plans to build a house for her children. She would like to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia Microfinance Company Limited.

loans.use: to purchase more goods for her business.

loans.name: Om-Akrm Group

texts.en:
This group is called Om-Akrm and is made up of five women who live in Hadramout, Yemen. They took out a loan of 150,000 (YER) from AMB. Fatima is a 48-year-old married woman with children. They live in Hadramout, Yemen. She is working hard to cover her family's expenses. She has a small house which is very old and needs a quick renovation. 

Fatima is requesting a loan of 30,000 YER, which she will use to buy construction supplies to use for her house. She hopes that after the completion of the renovation she will feel safe in her house with her family.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies to use for her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana is 44 years old. She lives in a small village of the Khobi district with her husband, two children, daughter-in-law and grandson. 

Nana requested loans from local financial institutions several times for family business start-ups, but without any success. Her loan requests were rejected all the time because of low income and family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of the income for the family is from agricultural activities. In particular, they have three milking cows, two calves and a pig. Nana produces cheese products for selling. Besides, they have a plot of agricultural land, where nut trees, bay trees and maize are grown. They sell the harvested products locally at a good price, but it is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Nana requested a loan from Credo to start a family business. Nana has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With her credit, Nana will begin trading fruits and vegetables. She plans to purchase fruits and vegetables at wholesale prices. Nana's son will transport them to buy at higher prices. This will increase their income. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to begin trading fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.en:
Dr. Jesus has been in business for over four years in El Paso, Texas, manufacturing "point of sale" or POS register machines for Mexico "macquiladoras".  A macquiladora is a manufacturing operation in a free-trade zone in Mexico where factories import material and equipment on a duty-free and tariff-free basis.  Currently, there are roughly 3000 macquiladoras with over 1.3 million Mexican workers.  

As a Mexican native from Juarez, Mexico, Dr. Jesus became a naturalized citizen of the United States and began his dream of owning his own business, Jarvam, LLC, and teaching at a local university.  His Ph.D. in systems engineering gives him the necessary skills and talent to manufacture his POS cash registers using radio frequency identification or RFID.  RFID is a wireless non-contact use of radio frequency electromagnetic fields to transfer data.  The main goal for these machines he creates is to manage and control inventory within the macquiladoras.  

Dr. Jesus came to Accion Texas Inc. when a community partner referred him.  He applied for a loan and received approval shortly after his application process was finished.  The $5,450 loan he received has been used to purchase components to manufacture the register, pay his one employee, create a working capital fund for his business, and begin the first steps to bring his machine and system into the United States market.  His ultimate goal is to offer his product in El Paso, Texas, and branch out to other cities and states.  “Without the Accion loan, I would not be able to offer the product in the United States,” says Dr. Jesus.

For now, Dr. Jesus will continue to develop advanced software for his machine, continue to teach, and market his product to local businesses here in the United States.

loans.use: to purchase components to manufacture the register, pay his one employee, create a working capital fund for his business, and begin the first steps to bring his machine and system into the United States market.

loans.name: Vohid

texts.ru: Вохиду 31 год. Он женат и является отцом одного ребенка. Вохид со своей семьей проживает в городе Турсунзаде. У него среднее образование. Он занимается растениеводством с 2003 года. У него имеется участок орошаемой земли, на котором он выращивает огородные культуры, в частности помидор, огурец, болгарский перец и т.д. В посеве и сборе урожая ему помогает жена. Вохид опытный земледелец, так как занимается этим делом уже 10 лет. Кредит запрашивает для посева и обработки земли. За счет прибыли он хочет улучшить условия проживания и провести ремонт в доме.
texts.en: Vohid is 31 years old, married, and a father to one child.  He and his family live in Tursun-zoda, Tajikistan.  He has a degree and has worked in agriculture since 2003.  He has a plot of irrigated land on which he grows vegetables including tomatoes, cucumbers, bell peppers and more.  His wife helps him with the sowing and harvesting.  Vohid is an experienced farmer, having 10 years of experience.  He is asking for a loan to plant and cultivate the land.  He plans to use the profits to improve his home and quality of life.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers and to plant vegetables

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Meet 25-year-old Zainab from Waterloo Eastern area in Freetown. She is single with one child aged two years.  She began her business because she wanted to create income to support her child and herself.

 In 2010, Zainab established her plastic slipper business.  She works at the business from 7:30 am until 6:00 pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and transportation difficulties.

Zainab requires a loan in order to purchase variety of slippers. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her standard of living and increase her business. In the future, Zainab plans to own the biggest shop in the community. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of slippers.

loans.name: Olivier

texts.en:
Olivier is 33 years old. He sells spare parts for motorcycles and he has benefited from the business for a couple of years. 

With the loan, he wants to buy more spare parts to sell. The profits from the business will be used to make more savings, for the better future of his business.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Nawal

texts.en:
Nawal is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo. 
Nawal is a 37 year old married woman from Rafah city. She lives in a small house with her husband and four sons. Nawal's husband is an employee and also works as a taxi driver at night. These two incomes are barely enough to cover the family's needs.
Nawal took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help Nawal's family by helping to fix the taxi, which is urgently needed. This loan will help increase the capacity of the taxi, and in turn increase income to help support the family.

loans.use: to pay the costs of fixing the taxi

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 33-year-old man. He lives in a simple house in Rafah City. Mohammad is an employee in the public sector. He gets a low income that barely covers the family needs. Mohammad took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help Mohammad to increase the family living conditions by buying some home appliances. Mohammad appears in Kiva profile picture.

loans.use: to buy some necessary home appliances.

loans.name: Fadi

texts.en: Fadi is a 28-year-old married man from Gaza. He is a father with two daughters. For the past four years, Fadi works in a grocery store that he owns. This project is somehow profitable, but not enough. Fadi took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to develop his grocery store by purchasing needed stock of basic groceries that customers often request such as rice, sugar and milk. This will increase sales and increase Fadi's income. Fadi appears in the photo while he was working in his store.

loans.use: to buy more grocery products to sell.

loans.name: Manal

texts.en:
Manal studied until only 8th grade and was married at the age of 17. She is now 40 years old, and is mother of eight children. She is dedicated to making a healthy life for herself and her family. In 2003, Manal’s in-laws opened a general store-gift shop. She began helping them, and learned the business from the bottom up. After they passed away in 2011, Manal and her husband gained ownership of the business. Due to her experience, determination and drive, Manal took over managing the business. It has been doing well, answering customer demands and taking advantage of is central location near Nazereth and the village of Shfaraam. 

Manal’s store, stocks products that are in demand and offers competitive and fair prices. Manal decided it was time to expand her store and diversify her products in order to meet customer requests. Manal needed this loan to assist in covering the costs for purchasing shelving, renovations, expanded stock, signage and an air conditioner.

Manal has one hired staff person and after the renovations wants to hire a second. She wants to see her children educated and gain good professions.

loans.use: To assist in covering the costs for purchase shelving, renovations, expanded stock, signage and an air conditioner for her shop.

loans.name: Ayman

texts.en: Ayman is a 38-year-old married man from Rafah. He is the father of three sons and two daughters. For the past six years, Ayman has been working on a taxi he owns. This is the only source of income for the family. Ayman took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help Ayman with some of the urgent expenses especially paying the cost of insurance and licensing fees for his taxi. Ayman appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the cost of insurance and licensing fees for his taxi.

loans.name: Khaleel

texts.en:
Khaleel is a 45-year-old honest and hardworking businessman. He has six children and a wife and they all live happily and peacefully in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. 

Khaleel has been running a cloth shop for seven years. He has a limited stock to offer customers. He has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. He would buy new varieties of cloth for selling and this would increase his sales. 

Khaleel wants a bright future for his children. With the help of this loan, he could expand his business and his net income and savings would also be increased. After getting the profit he would pay the educational expenses of his children. Khaleel is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for helping him.

loans.use: To purchase new varieties of cloth.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a 35-year-old woman who is married and a responsible mother with five sons. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Razia belongs to a very poor family. Her husband sells waste materials to recycling factories which is the only source of income for the family. He is a very hardworking person who collects waste material door to door and then sells it to the recycling factories. Razia's husband wants to open a shop for his work but, due to the lack of money, this is difficult. 

Razia is requesting a loan through the Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband open a recycling shop. She is very thankful to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to help her husband open a recycling shop

loans.name: Ananías

texts.es: Don Ananías es un agricultor con muchos años de experiencia, se preocupa porque la cosecha de café que recoge cada año sea de buena calidad y abundante, por eso abona bien la tierra y le proporciona todos los insumos agrícolas necesarios para lograrlo. La siembra que está realizando actualmente necesita de esos insumos por lo que está solicitando un crédito de seiscientos mil colones (¢600.000) para comprar productos como abono, plaguicida, insecticida entre otros y de este modo mantener calidad y cantidad en su cosecha .
texts.en:
Ananias is a farmer with many years experience. He is concerned that his coffee harvest, which he gathers each year, should be of good quality and abundant. For this reason, he fertilizes the land well and he dispenses all the necessary agricultural inputs to assure that.

The sowing currently underway, now requires these inputs. For that reason, Ananias is requesting a loan of 600,000 colons to purchase products such as manure, insecticides, and anti-plague applications, among other items. 

In this manner, Ananias intends to maintain the quality and quantity of his harvest.

loans.use: buy agricultural inputs to maintain his coffee plants and improve the harvest.

loans.name: Nidia

texts.es: Nidia vive en el sector norte de la capital, en zona rural, en este lugar como en la mayor parte del país ya iniciaron las lluviaa, lo que la tiene muy preocupada, pues el techo de su casa está muy deteriorado y el agua se filtra por paredes y cielo raso, además necesita hacer varias reparaciones urgentes en la mayor parte de su vivienda, necesita un millón de colones (¢1.000.000) para comprar materiales como cemento , arena , zinc, madera, etc, e iniciar el trabajo de restauración antes de que aumenten las lluvia, manifiesta Nidia su agradecimiento y felicidad que le causa el poder contar con esta oportunidad de financiamiento
texts.en: Nidia lives in a rural area in the north of the capital.  Here, like in most of the country, the rains have started and this worries Nidia.  The roof of her house is damaged and the water is filtering through the walls and the flat roof.  Moreover, Nidia needs to do urgent repairs in most of her house and so needs one million Colon in order to buy materials such as cement, sand, zinc, wood and more.  She can then start the work before the rains get worse.  Nidia is very grateful and happy to be able to count on this financial opportunity.

loans.use: to buy materials to repair her home.

loans.name: Sidey

texts.es: Sidey es una señora muy trabajadora. Necesita un préstamo para comprar  almácigo de café (plantas pequeñas en desarrollo)  ella se ha dedicado a esta actividad agrícola desde hace varios años y tanto ella como sus hijos dependen  de los ingresos que esta labor le proporciona , necesita un crédito por quinientos mil colones (500.000), con este dinero comprará el almácigo con el que renovará su cafetal y continiuará su labor durante el año.
texts.en: Sidey is very hard-working.  She needs a loan to buy coffee seedlings (young plants).  She has been doing this agricultural work for a numbers of years and both she and her children depend on the money she earns from this work.  Sidey needs a loan of 500,000 Colon to buy the seedlings.  She can then renew her coffee plantation and continue her work throughout the year.

loans.use: to buy coffee seedlings (young plants).

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy lives in Nanyuki, Kenya. She is married with four school-going children. She has been farming for more than ten years in her family land. She mostly plants maize, beans, potatoes and carrots. 

She got acquainted with Milango through friends and now she seeks a loan of 10,734 Kenya shillings to purchase tea tree seedlings. She wants to venture into this new category to utilize the opportunities that come with tea tree plantations.

Weather is her major challenge.

loans.use: To buy tea tree seedlings

loans.name: Precilla

texts.en:
Pricella is 57 years old, married, and has seven children. She runs a wood business from her home in Waterloo 2 Eastern area in Freetown, which she has been doing for 10 years. She started her business so she can earn income at home.
