Pricella is requesting a loan from BRAC Sierra Leone, which she will use to purchase more wood to expand her business. She describes her major hardships as inadequate funds to run her business and transportation problems.  The extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and repay her loan. In the future, Pricella would like to change her business to a grocery store.

loans.use: to purchase wood to expand her business

loans.name: Evariste

texts.en: Evariste is 31 years old. He sells foodstuffs and has been in the business for four years. He is married and has two children. With the loan, he wants to buy more rice, sugar, and cooking oil for resale. The profits from the business will be used to buy a house for his residence.

loans.use: To buy more rice, sugar, and cooking oil

loans.name: Sharof

texts.ru: Шароф жизнерадостный мужчина в возрасте 55 лет. Он женат и является многодетным отцом, так как имеет шестерых детей. Шароф со своей женой живут душа в душу, и стараются воспитывать своих детей хорошими людьми. Его два старших сына уже имеют свою семью и детей. Шароф и его жена очень рады растить своих внуков. Для того, чтобы иметь доход на проживание Шароф занимается своим бизнесом. Вот уже на протяжении двух лет он занимается купля продажей фруктов и овощей. Раньше он занимался деканством и потом решил реализовывать свой урожай. Он перевозит на собственной грузовой машине урожай, который получил от своего дехканства в город на рынок для продажи. А также покупает на рынке другого вида овощи и фрукты и продаёт их в своём селе. Этот бизнес приносит ему постоянный хороший доход. И сейчас Шароф хочет расширить свой бизнес, обустроить возле своего дома небольшой прилавок, где его жена будет продавать разнообразные овощи и фрукты. Поэтому он хочет взять кредит для закупа большого ассортимента овощей и фруктов. Для получения кредита он обратился в Арванд и надеется на положительный результат.
texts.en: Sharof is a cheerful man, 55 years of age.  He is married and is a father to six children.  Sharof and his wife live in harmony and try to raise their children to be good people.  His two older sons already have their own families.  Sharof and his wife are very happy to raise their grandchildren.  To earn a living, Sharof runs his own business.  For the last two years, he has sold fruits and vegetables.  Previously, he worked in farming but then he decided to sell his own crops.  He uses his own vehicle to transport his crops to a market in the city to sell.  At the market he also buys other types of fruits and vegetables to sell back in his village.  This business brings in consistent income.  Now, Sharof wants to expand and build a small counter near his home where his wife will sell different types of fruits and vegetables.  For this reason he wants to take out a loan to buy a large assortment of fruits and vegetables.  For this loan, he turned to Arvand and he hopes for a positive outcome.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Rahimjon

texts.ru: Рахимчон женатый мужчина. Ему 30 лет. Он заботливый отец двоих детей. Он вместе с семьей живет и работает в городе Турсунзаде. Жена Рахимчона занимается хозяйственными делами по дому и помогает Рахимчону в продвижении деятельности. Рахимчон занимается растениеводством на протяжения 10 лет. Он зарабатывает на жизнь путем посева и продажи овощей. У него имеется участок орошаемой земли, на которой он выращивает в основном помидоры, огурцы и другие виды овощей. Рахимчон запрашивает кредит для приобретения минерального удобрения. Он хочет получить богатый урожай и за счет дохода с его продажи планирует приобрести землю и построить дом своей мечты.
texts.en: Rahimjon is 30 years old and married.  He is a caring father to two children.  He lives with his family in Tursun-zoda, he works there as well.  Rahimjon's wife works as a homemaker and helps him with his business in agriculture.  This has been Rahimjon's profession for 10 years.  He earns a living growing and selling vegetables.  He has a plot of irrigated land where he grows tomatoes, cucumbers and other types of vegetables.  Rahimjon is asking for a loan to buy mineral fertilizers.  He wants to have a rich harvest.  He plans to use the income to buy land and build his dream home.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Imad

texts.en: Imad is a 41-year-old married man living with his wife and four children, who are still attending school. He owns a small plot of land where he sells used metal and supplies. His income is barely sufficient, and he has difficulty in paying the high costs of living. At present, Imad is asking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to enlarge his operations by purchasing added supplies to sell such as aluminum products and metal car spare parts. Imad took advantage of a first Kiva loan, and he was very satisfied with the results, especially that the loan amount was sufficient to fulfill his business needs. In the future, he is planning to expand his business into other areas.

loans.use: to enlarge his operations by purchasing added supplies to sell

loans.name: Laura

texts.es: Laura es ama de casa, madre de tres niños, tiene un taller de costura en el cual confecciona prendas de vestir, como pijamas, blusas, sueters, etc. su proyecto tiene mucha demanda tanto en el mercado local como en otros comercios a los que ella les vende su producto. Necesita comprar variedad de  telas para elaborar las prendas y otros accesorios como hilos, botones etc, para esto solicita un crédito por un millón de colones (¢1.000.000), manifiesta que al obtener este material podrá fabricar más prendas y expander más su mercado, manifiesta que esto lo logrará gracias al financiamiento comunal que le han ofrecido las empresas de crédito comunal.
texts.en:
Laura is a homemaker and is the mother of three children.  She has a sewing workshop where she makes clothing items, like pajamas, blouses, sweaters, etc.  There is a lot of demand for her products in both the local markets and in the other shops that sell her items.  

She needs to buy a variety of fabrics in order to make clothing items, as well as accessories like thread, buttons, etc.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan for one million colones (¢1.000.000).

She says that in obtaining these materials, she will be able to make more clothing and to further expand her market.  She says that she will achieve this thanks to the communal financing that the communal loan organizations have offered her.

loans.use: to buy fabric so that she can make clothing items, and accessories.

loans.name: Mary

texts.es: Mary es una madre de familia muy esforzada y con gran habilidad para diseñar prendas de vestir de todo tipo usando la máquina tejedora,su trabajo tiene mucha demanda, pero necesita comprar una máquina tejedora más moderna y más rápida, para mejorar tanto cantidad como calidad en sus prendas. Ella solicita trescientos mil colones (¢300.000) con esto adquirirá dicha máquina. Agradece la oprotunidad de poder comprar este artículo que le ayudará a incrementar sus ingresos y a satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en: Mary is a wife and mother who works very hard ad is very good at designing items of clothing of all kinds using a knitting machine. Her work is much in demand, but she needs to buy a more modern knitting and faster machine to improve both the quality and quantity of her clothes. She is asking for three hundred thousand colones (¢300.000) to acquire the machine. She is grateful for the opportunity to be able to buy this item which will help her increase her income and meet her customer's demands.

loans.use: to buy a knitting machine to make items of clothing.

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
This is 50-year-old Salamatu from Waterloo eastern area in Freetown. She is married with 3 children between the ages of 14 years and 17 years. She began this business because she wants to stop sitting at home as a housewife and create a source of income to support the home.

Salamatu runs a general store; she sells drinks, cigarettes, biscuits, and soap. She has been running this business since 1999. She works at the business every day moving around the community to introduce her goods.  She says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation.

Salamatu has requested a loan in order to purchase items such as drinks, cigarettes, biscuits, and soap. The extra income from this loan will allow her to pay her children's school fees and improve her standard of living. In the future, she plans to open a shop. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to purchase items such as drinks, cigarettes, biscuits, and soap.

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en:
Monicah lives in Nanyuki, Kenya. She is married with five children. Farming has been her business for the last 12 years. She mostly plants maize, beans, passion fruit, and bananas. 

She knew Milango through an employee. She wants to plant a tea tree plantation in her farm. She seeks a loan of 10,734 Kenyan shillings to make this a reality. In five years she wants to be producing tons of tea tree products for sale.

Weather change is the major challenge she faces in her farming endeavors.

loans.use: To purchase tea tree seedlings.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is 44 years old and lives at West point area which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is married and has six children between 12 and 29 years old. Only one is in school and lives at home. She was unable to go to school. She describes herself as a hardworking woman. For the past two years she has been selling charcoal in the local market. She sells six days a week from 8AM to 6PM. She like her business because the customers buy from her, and she started this business with money given to her by her mother. She uses a shared-bus every time to get her goods at her business shop. She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal for her business. She plans to build a house for her children. She says thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Francess

texts.en: Francess is 48 years old and lives at West Point area which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is a widow, and she has five children between 22 and 30 years old. She describes herself as a hardworking woman. For the past 20 years she has been operating her own table where she sells dry fish in the local market. She sells six days a week from 7AM to 5PM. She likes her business because she has more customers, and she started this business with money given to her by her mother. She uses a shared-taxi every time to get her goods at her business table. She is requesting a loan to purchase dry fish for her business. She plans to build a house for her children. She would like to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase dry fish for her business.

loans.name: Ignace

texts.en: Ignace is 33 years old. He sells shoes and has been in the business for 10 years. With the loan, he will buy more shoes to sell. His wife is a businesswoman, and the profits from the business will be used to make more savings.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Zokirjon

texts.ru: Зокирчону 30 лет. Он женат. Зокирчон отец двоих детей. Он имеет среднее образование. Зокирчон честный и предприимчивый человек. Он со своей семьей проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Жена Зокирчона работает на рынке. Она продавщица детских одежд. Сам Зокирчон занимается растениеводством. Он начал работу в этой области 6 лет назад, и до сих пор продолжает заниматься этим делом. Зокирчон в основном занимается посевами огородных культур, в частности помидоров, огурцов и т.д. Он берет кредит для закупа минерального удобрения для урожая овощей. Зокирчон за счет полученного дохода от бизнеса планирует открыть депозит на будущее своих детей.
texts.en: Zokirjon is 30 years old, married, and the father of two children. He has a high school education and is an honest and enterprising man. He and his family live in the city of Tursun-zoda. His wife sells children's clothing at the market. Zokirjon himself performs agricultural work. He began farming six years ago and still continues to this day. Zokirjon mainly plants vegetables, including tomatoes, cucumbers, and others. He is asking for a loan in order to purchase fertilizer for his vegetable crops. He plans to use the income from his crop sales to open a savings account for his children's future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for vegetable crops

loans.name: Fatu

texts.en: Fatu is 19 years old and lives in the West point area that has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is single, and has three children between the ages of 3 years old and 3 months old. Only one is presently in school and all three of them live at home. She was unable to go to school. She described herself as a hardworking woman. For the past two years, she has been selling soft drinks in the local market. She sells six days a week from 9 a.m. to 6 p.m. She likes her business because of the ways customers buy from her. She started this business with money given to her by mother. She used a shared taxi every time to get her goods to her business spot. She is requesting a loan to purchase more soft drinks for her business. She plans to build a house for her children. She would like to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks for her business

loans.name: Jegbeh

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 40-year-old Jegbeh from the Waterloo eastern area of Freetown. She is married with five children between the ages of 3 years and 22 years. Three of her children attend school. She started her business to help with the daily survival for her family.
 
Jegbeh runs a cookery business. She sells cookery at her house and she has been running this business since 2005. She works at the business from 4:30; she will not rest until the food is finished. Jegbeh says that the main challenge to her business is the problem of price control in the market.

Jegbeh has requested a loan in order to food commodities like cooking seasonings, oil, and rice. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children. In the future, she plans to have a permanent business residence. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy food commodities like cooking seasonings, oil, and rice.

loans.name: Jeremie

texts.en: Jeremie is 30 years old. He is single and has been in the business for three years. With the loan, he wants to buy more used shoes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to make more savings. He has been very positive with his business since he started the business. Jeremie has been successfully solving the problems that he has been encountering.

loans.use: to buy shoes to sell

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is 49 years old and lives in the West point area, which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is married with five children aged 26, 19, 12, 9, and 5. Only three are in school. She was unable to go to school. She describes herself as a hardworking woman. For the past four years she has been selling dried fish in the local market. She sells six days a week from 7 a.m. to 5 p.m. She likes her business because of the ways customers buy from her and she started this business with money given to her by her mother. She uses a shared taxi every time to get her goods to her business spot. She is requesting a loan to purchase more dried fish for her business. She plans to build a house for her children.  She would like to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish for her business

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce lives in Nanyuki, Kenya. She has nine children; three of them are attending school. She does farming for a living. She plants sweet potatoes, bananas, arrowroot, and maize. She plans to add another crop to her farm: tea tree.

She knew about Milango through friends and now she seeks a loan of 20,730 Kenyan shillings to buy tea tree seedlings. The major challenge she faces is the weather that is not even. She wants to increase her income so as to improve her standard of living. She also rears cows on her farm, which provide little income.

loans.use: to purchase tea tree seedlings.

loans.name: Herminda

texts.es:
Picoaza consta en los libros como uno de los pueblos aborígenes parte de la cultura manteña, esta parroquia urbana situada a tan solo diez minutos de la ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita, aquí se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal María Asunción.

En este lugar vive la señora Herminda, tiene 76 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen nueve hijos, todos mayores de edad, una hija que está separada vive con ella. Su esposo ya no trabaja por enfermedad.

Ella realiza el crédito para invertirlo en un taller de cerrajería que tienen en su casa con uno de sus hijos, este negocio lo tenía su esposo que por motivos de enfermedad tuvo que dejar y ahora su hijo se hace cargo del trabajo y ella recibe parte de las ganancias,  es con esto que ella y sus esposo salen adelante. En el taller realizan muchos trabajos con el metal, el aluminio y el vidrio, construyen puertas, ventanas, estructuras y varias cosas más, este taller lo tienen desde hace 20 años y es allí donde sus hijos aprendieron el oficio con el cual salen adelante.

Este crédito es para comprar hierro, soldaduras y pinturas para el taller. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le han dado  a lo largo de este tiempo. 

Su sueño es seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Picoaza appears in books as one of the aboriginal villages of the Manteña culture.  This urban parish is situated only 10 minutes from the city of Portoviejo, capital of the Manabi province.  Here, members of the María Asunción community bank meet every two weeks.

In this place lives Herminda, who is 76 years old.  She is married, and from this marriage she has 9 children, all of whom are adults.  One daughter, who is separated, lives with her.  Her husband no longer works due to illness.

She is requesting the loan to invest it in a locksmith's workshop that they have in their house with one of their children.  Her husband had this business, but had to give it up due to illness, and now her son is responsible for the work and she receives part of the earnings.  It is with this that she and her husband get ahead.

In the workshop, they do a lot of work with metal, aluminum and glass.  They build doors, windows, structures and various other things.  They have had this workshop for 20 years, and it is there that her children learned the trade that allows them to get ahead.

This loan is to buy iron, solders and paints for the workshop.  She has been with the community bank from the beginning, and she likes it for the help that it has given her throughout this time.  Her dream is to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy iron, solders and paints

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 25-year-old Fatmata from Waterloo in the eastern rural area in Freetown. She is married and has three children between the ages of 3 years and 10 years. Two of her children are attending school. 

Fatmata runs a general stock business within her community; she sells cigarettes, soap, milk, gari (cassava flakes) and sugar. She has been running this business since 2004. She works at the business 8 hours a day and 7 days per week.  Her major challenge is insufficient capital to run her business. 

Fatmata has requested a loan in order to buy more cigarettes, soap, milk, gari and sugar for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to repay her loans and pay her children’s school fees. 

In the future, she plans to become a wholesaler in the fish business. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more cigarettes, soap, milk, gari and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Hmoud

texts.en:
Hmoud is a 54-year-old father of four sons and one daughter. After his retirement from the military department, Hmoud opened a mini-market where he is selling a few types of snacks and food products. 

Now Hmoud is applying for a loan to add more types of basic food products and some canned food like canned tuna and beans.

loans.use: to add more types of basic food products and some  canned food like canned tuna and beans.

loans.name: Adama

texts.en:
Meet 45-year-old Adama from Waterloo, Eastern area, in Freetown. She is married and has six children between the ages of 4 years and 20 years. Three of her children are currently attending school. 

In 2001, Adama established her natural medicines business. She began her business because she was trained by her grandmother. She works at the business from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m., Monday to Saturday. She says that the main challenge to her business is the slow purchasing power of customers.

Adama requires a loan in order to purchase more natural medicines to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. 

In the future, Adama plans to expand her natural medicines more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more natural medicines to expand her business.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Mariama is 27 years old and married with one child aged five years. She runs a pharmacy business in Waterloo 2 Eastern area in Freetown. She began this business because she wants to be self-independent. 

She's been in this business for two years and sells wood at her house. She describes her major hardship as inadequate funds to run her business and transportation problems.  

Mariama requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase medical drugs to expand her business. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and improve her status. In the future, she would like to open a big pharmacy.  She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase medical drugs to expand her business

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es:
Vicente tiene 59 años de edad es casado tiene dos hijos vive con la esposa y con los hijos.

Vicente vive en Guaranda se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maiz, trigo y arveja, el dinero lo necesita para la compra de semillas, abonos, fertilizantes y funguicidas. El credito le ayudado a crecer la productividad de los sembrios.

Vicente compra los productos en Comercial Prado en Guaranda.

El sueño de Vicente es comprar un terreno para construir una casa y un poco para sembrar.

En los tiepos libres le gusta hacer deporte, adeas le gusta festejar las fiestas de carnaval.
texts.en:
Vicente is 59 years old. He is married and has two children. He lives with his wife and children. 

Vicente lives in Guaranda. He works in agriculture, harvesting corn, wheat, and peas. He needs money to buy seeds, manure, fertilizers and fungicides. The loan has helped him to increase the productivity of his fields.

Vicente buys the products in Comercial Prado in Guaranda.

Vicente's dream is to buy land to build a house and a little for planting. 

In his free time, Vicente enjoys playing sports. He also likes to attend Carnaval celebrations.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure, fertilizers, and fungicides.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages to meet her customers’ demand on a regular basis.

loans.name: Willimena

texts.en: Willimena is 41 years old and lives in West Point area, which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is living with her fiance, who is a security man, and they both have three children between the ages of 9 and 15 years old. Their children are in school and live at home. Willimena described herself as a hardworking person. For the past eight years, she has been running a shop where she sells bowls, pans, spoons, cups, etc., in the local market. She likes her business because customers buy from her, and she started this business with money given to her by her husband. She walks every day to buy her ingredients since her shop is much closer to the local market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more bowls, pans, spoons, cups, etc., for her business. She plans to buy a piece of land and build a house. She would like to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia to enable small business owners to increase their business volume.

loans.use: to purchase more bowls, pans, spoons, cups, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Jameelah

texts.en:
Jameeleh is a 57-year-old conservative woman, so she asked her youngest daughter to appear in the photo instead. 

Jameeleh is the mother of five. Her youngest is Ghadeer, a 20-year-old lady who is attending the university to get her bachelor’s degree in graphic design. For that, Jameeleh is applying today for an educational loan to pay for her daughter’s semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter’s semester fees.

loans.name: Christina

texts.en: Christina is 32 years old and lives in the West point area, which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is married and has three children between the ages of 3 and 15 years old. Her children are in school and live at home. She describes herself as a hardworking woman, and she has been running a shop, where she sells charcoal in the local market, for the past ten years. She sells six days a week from 7AM to 4PM. She likes her business because customers buy from her, and she started this business with money given to her by her mother. She uses a pick-up every time to get her goods to her business shop. She is requesting a loan to purchase more goods for her business. She plans to build a house for her children. Christina would like to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more goods for her business.

loans.name: Joselyne

texts.en: Joselyne is 61 years old. She sells animals and has spent five years running the business. With this loan, she will buy more animals such as cows to sell. The profits from her business will be used to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more cows to sell

loans.name: Maria Josefina

texts.es:
MARIA tiene 34 años, es casada tiene 4 hijos, vive con el esposo e hijos en la ciudad de Guaranda Provincia Bolívar.

La VRC Tagma Rumiñahui, esta conformada casi a 25 minutos de la oficina de San Simón, se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería.

MARIA  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz. papas, además se dedica a la crianza y venta de cerdos y ganado.

Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, fertilizantes, urea, líquidos para la maleza y comprar cerdos.

Con el apoyo del crédito va incrementar sus animales y mejorar los sembríos. Realiza sus compras cada 15 días en la ciudad de Guaranda.El sueño es tener su propio vehículo y comprar un terreno.


En el tiempo libre le gusta salir a caminar y festejar las fiestas por que le gusta bailar.
texts.en:
Maria is 34 years old. She is married and has 4 children. Maria lives with her spouse and children in the city of Guaranda in the Bolivar Province. 

The VRC Tagma Rumiñahui, located almost 25 minutes from the San Simón office, focuses on agriculture and cattle ranching.

Maria works in agriculture, growing corn and potatoes, as well as raising and selling pigs and cattle. 

Maria is requesting the loan to buy pigs, seeds, fertilizers, urea, and weed killer.

With the help of the loan, Maria is going to buy more animals and improve her fields. She does her shopping every 15 days in the city of Guaranda. Her dream is to have her own vehicle and buy land.

In her free time, Maria likes to go out walking and go to parties because she likes to dance.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, urea, weed killer, and pigs.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia lives in Nanyuki, Kenya. She has seven children. She does farming for a living. She plants sweet potatoes, beans and maize. She plans to add another crop to her farm: tea trees.

Julia knew Milango through friends and now she seeks a loan of 10,734 Kenya shillings to buy tea tree seedlings. The major challenge she faces is inconsistent weather. She wants to increase her income so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase tea tree seedlings.

loans.name: Rania

texts.en: Rania is a 35-year-old conservative woman, thus she asked her husband to take her place in the photo. Rania and her husband provide a printing services business. Most of their orders are wedding invitations and advertising flyers. Having a wide base of print houses, Rania’s husband can get a suitable price to each customer in making their own profits. Now Rania wants to improve the business and have a special room in the house for the business as their temporary office until they get their own separate one. She is applying for a loan to renovate the room in a way that it fits the printings and their samples.

loans.use: to renovate the room in a way that fits the printings and their samples.

loans.name: Mar'ah

texts.en:
Mar’ah runs a small stall which sells snacks, drinks, and mobile phone airtime credits. Mar’ah lives in Bogor, a peri-urban area about two hours from Jakarta. Mar’ah is married and living with four persons in the family home.  

To increase the family income, Mar’ah also works as a dealer. She joined Ruma twelve months ago because she wanted to increase her income. She feels really excited to expand her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and processing bill payments for customers. For the last three months, she has earned an average of $25/day in mobile phone airtime credit sales. 

Mar’ah is starting to process electricity bill payments for her customers. This is a much-needed service in the area and will increase her income. To provide this new service, Mar’ah is required to print out receipts for customers. A Kiva loan will help her to purchase this printer, so she will be able to offer the new service.

loans.use: to purchase a printer for printing out required receipts for mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: Alisher

texts.ru: Алишеру 26 лет. Он женат и имеет одного маленького ребенка. Алишер живет вместе с родителями в городе Турсунзаде. Его родители пенсионеры, а его младший брат работает за пределами страны. У Алишера жена домохозяйка. Алишер имеет среднее образование. Он зарабатывает на жизнь путем земледелия. Алишер в течение трех лет работает в этой области. Он имеет земельный участок, на котором выращивает огородные культуры такие как помидоры, огурцы и другие виды овощей. Алишер берет кредит для закупа минерального удобрения, чтобы улучшить процесс выращивания овощей. Он планирует отремонтировать дом за счет полученного дохода от деятельности.
texts.en: Alisher is 26 years old.  He is married and has one small child.  Alisher lives together with his parents in the city of Tursun-zoda.  His parents are retired, and his younger brother works abroad.  Alisher's wife is a homemaker.  Alisher has a secondary education.  He earns a living through agriculture.  Alisher has been working in this area for three years.  He has a land plot, where he grows horticultural crops like tomatoes, cucumbers and other types of vegetables.  Alisher is requesting this loan to purchase mineral fertilizers in order to improve the process of growing vegetables.  He plans to repair his house with the business profits.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Njoki

texts.en:
Njoki lives in Nanyuki, Kenya. She has seven children. She does farming for a living. She plants passion fruit, beans and maize. She plans to add another crop to her farm: Tea trees.

She knew Milango through friends and now she seeks a loan of 10,734 Kenya shillings to buy tea tree seedlings. She also plans to do dairy farming. The major challenge she faces is uneven weather. She wants to increase her income so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase tea tree seedlings.

loans.name: Shorouq

texts.en: Shorouq is a 19-year-old single woman living with her ten siblings in Al Mafraq, a city located in northeastern Jordan. Shorouq goes to a government university in another city to study for her bachelor degree in monuments and traditional places maintenance. She is applying for an educational loan to pay for her next semester's fees.

loans.use: to pay for her next semester's fees.

loans.name: Ramatu

texts.en:
Meet 50-year-old Ramatu from Waterloo in the eastern area of Freetown. She is married with five children.  In 2010, Ramatu established her store. She began her business because she wants to create income to support the home. She works at the business from 8:00am until 7:00pm, seven days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and high cost of transportation.

Ramatu requires a loan in order to purchase cigarettes, pure water and biscuits to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to empower herself and increase her business. In the future, Ramatu plans to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase cigarettes, pure water and biscuits in order to expand her business.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en: Marie is 35 years old. She is married with five children. She owns a milling machine and has been running the business for two years. With this loan, she would like to buy another milling machine, specifically for maize. She plans to use her profits for renovating her family's house.

loans.use: To buy another milling machine for sale.

loans.name: Sri

texts.en:
Sri is a housewife, and she also sells mobile phone airtime credits. She lives in Bogor, a peri-urban area about two hours from Jakarta. Sri is married and living with four persons in the family home.  

To increase the family’s income, Sri also works as a dealer. She joined Ruma one month ago because she wanted to increase her income. She feels really excited to expand her business of selling mobile phone airtime credits and processing bill payments for customers. She earns an average of $3-10/day in mobile phone airtime credit sales. 

Sri is starting to process electricity bill payments for her customers. This is a much-needed service in the area and will increase her income. To provide this new service, Sri is required to print out receipts for customers. A Kiva loan will help her purchase this printer, so she will be able to offer the new service.

loans.use: to purchase a printer for printing out required receipts for mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is 27 years old. She owns a motorcycle, which her husband has been using to earn income. With this loan, Florence would like to buy another motorcycle in order to increase their income. The profits from the business will be used to renovate the house.

loans.use: To buy another motocycle.

loans.name: Maria Agustina

texts.es:
MARIA tiene 55 años de edad, es casada tiene un hijo, vive con su esposo en la ciudad de Guaranda Provincia Bolívar.

La VRC Tagma Rumiñahui, esta conformada por 14 socios casi a 25 minutos de la oficina de San Simón, se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería.

Se dedica al cultivo de papas y maíz,ademas a la  crianza y venta de pollos cuyes y cerdos.

Solicita el crédito para compra de semillas, abonos para los cultivos y balanceado para los animales. Con el apoyo del crédito va a criar y venderlo para obtener mas dinero.

El sueño tener dienro para dar la profesion al hijo.

En su tiempo libre le gusta salir de paseo con el hijo y conversar.
texts.en:
María is 55 years old, married, and has one son. She lives with her husband in the city of Guaranda in the province of Bolívar.

The Tagma Rumiñahui communal bank is made up of 14 members and is located about 25 minutes from the San Simón office of the field partner. The members work in agriculture and raising cattle.

María works growing potatoes and corn, as well as raising and selling chickens, guinea pigs and pigs.

She is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer for her crops and balanced feed for her animals. With the loan she is going to grow, raise and sell her products to earn more money. Her dream is to have enough money to give her son a profession. In her free time she likes to go for walks with her son and talk.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer for her crops and balanced feed for her animals.

loans.name: 15 De Junio Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “15 DE JUNIO”  iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Alto Lima, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Antonia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: artesanía en zapatos y sombreros, venta de material de construcción, costura de chalecos, tienda de barrio, tejedora de polainas, tienda de abarrotes, tejido de mantas de lana, artesanía en zapatos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Antonia es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a su casa a visitarla. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de comida; este negocio lo aprendió de un trabajo anterior  y decide instalar su negocio independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de máquina broster) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo instalará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las consultas médicas y los ahorros.
texts.en:
The "15 de junio" (June 15th) Communal Bank will begin its third cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Alto Lima Regional Office. It is made up of eight members and led by a board of directors of which Antonia is President. The businesses that the communal bank members carry out are varied. The businesses are handmade shoes and hats, the sale of construction materials, sewing of vests, neighborhood stores, weaving of leg warmers, grocery store, weaving of wool blankets and handmade shoes. 

The credit that will be taken out will benefit the small businesses including that of Antonia. She says that she started with Pro Mujer a year ago, having been invited by a promoter for the institution who went to her house to visit her. She currently has a food business. She learned this trade at a former job and decided to open up her own independent business. 

The loan that she will now take out is to increase her working capital by purchasing a fryer that she will get from the El Alto markets. She will then install it at her business space. This type of work allows her to generate resources to take care of her home. She is married and has three children. 

When asking what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the medical consults and savings program.

loans.use: to buy a fryer.

loans.name: Ahlam

texts.en:
Ahlam is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo. 
Ahlam is a married woman from Jabalia city. She is a mother with three kids: two sons and one daughter. Ahlam's husband works as an employee and gets a low salary. This is the only source of income for the family. 

Ahlam is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to help her cover the cost of purchasing a new oven and refrigerator in order to improve the living conditions in her house. Taking this loan will offer Ahlam a comfortable home so she can enjoy living in her house with her family.

loans.use: to buy a new oven and refrigerator.

loans.name: Alwafa Group

texts.en:
This group is called Alwafa and consists of the three members: Hayah, Amnh, and Khamisa who live in Aden, Yemen. They are hardworking women. 

Khamisa is 53 years old, a married woman who is the leader of this group. She was selling fruits, tea, etc. in the first loan. She describes herself as honest, trustworthy, and courteous. She would like to sell different types of items like perfumes and clothes, so she applied for a second loan of 60,000 YER from AMB to buy perfumes and clothes to increase her profits. All members of this group is grateful of kiva lenders to finance them in the first loan. All members wish to improve their living standards.

loans.use: to buy perfumes and clothes to increase her profits.

loans.name: Saddam

texts.en: Saddam is a 23-year-old single man who has three brothers and a married sister. Saddam is a third year university student majoring in Finance and Banking. He is applying for this educational loan to pay for his next semester's fees.

loans.use: to pay for his next semester's fees.

loans.name: Ghina

texts.en:
Ghina is a 27-year-old single woman who has been employed in a construction company for seven years. She has a very good reputation in her work among her coworkers and family members.

Ghina is a hard worker who puts so much effort on finishing requested work in a very good way, and to respond to her mother's medical needs as fast as she can.

Ghina is always worried about her mom and puts so much effort into pleasing her and keeping her in good health. The loan for which she has applied will help her to pay for her mother's medical needs, and she will also use part of the loan to help her sister buy a car.

She hopes to stay capable of providing for her mother's needs.

loans.use: To pay for her mother's medical needs.

loans.name: Zamida

texts.en: Zamida is 39 years old. She sells different items in her boutique. She has requested the loan to add more corn flour and clothes for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more corn flour and clothes for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more spare parts for sale.

loans.name: Al-Susan Group

texts.en:
Al-Susan is a group that consists of four ladies who live in Aden, Yemen. They are women who work hard in order to increase their income. They applied for a loan of 180,000 YER. 

Fatehia is a 26-year-old single woman who lives in poor conditions. She hopes to improve her living conditions. She says she does not have enough money to buy what she needs. Therefore, she has requested a loan of 60,000 YER from AMB to buy construction supplies to renew her house.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies to renew her house.

loans.name: Najah

texts.en: Najah is a 20-year-old married woman and the mother of a baby daughter. Her husband works two jobs: he sells clothes at one job and installs tents for events at the other job. While her husband is working hard to support his family, Najah also wanted to participate a little bit, so she started last winter selling blankets to relatives and friends. She managed to increase the number of customers by the word of mouth, so she decided to increase the her quantity of goods and add selling bed sheets and bed cover sets. For that purpose, she applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: to increase her quantity of goods and add selling bed sheets and bed cover sets.

loans.name: Khamisi

texts.en:
Khamisi's first loan helped him to stabilize his business. He is now seeking another loan of 41,850 Kenya shillings to purchase to buy three bags of sugar, 20 bales of maize flour and five bales wheat flour. This will help him attract more customers to his business.

Income from the loan will help him save more and even start other businesses.

loans.use: to buy three bags of sugar, 20 bales of maize flour and five bales wheat flour.

loans.name: Marie's Group

texts.en:
The group called Marie's is on their fourth loan cycle with ID-Ghana. They are selling beef, beans, materials, shirts and provisions. They have formed this group to mediate in many ways for one another. 

One of the members is Samuel, who is standing on the far right in the photograph and is a tailor. Through ID-Ghana's help and his own hard work his situation is improving, but he is also aware that the work and effort he is putting in must be continuous and permanent if he is to achieve total success and be able to give his family better well-being. As a tailor and selling material, his business shop is located in a very advantageous point where business is very good for him.

Samuel is requesting this loan so he can purchase more materials to sell to customers and as well to sew and sell, which will help him to settle his business plans and improve his income.

They need a total amount of GHS 4650 to be able to expand their respective businesses.

loans.use: To buy materials to sell to customers.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is a 53-year-old hardworking and enterprising woman with many dreams to fulfill. She lives in the area of Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She has been in the business of clothes selling for almost 15 years. She purchases clothes from different areas and sells them for a profitable amount. 

Parveen is a responsible mother of 5 children. Her husband makes his living as a daily worker, but his income is not sufficient to meet the needs of the family members. She faced many problems in her early married life, but now her contribution to the family income is playing a vital role in fulfilling the needs of the family members.

To cope with the increasing demand during the summer season, she has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase a variety of clothes in different colors. She hopes to get an increase in her net income and wishes to spend part of the profits on the improvement of her house. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase new colorful clothes

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is 39 years old. He sells shoes and has been running this business for two years. With the loan, he would like to buy more shoes for sale. He plans to use the profits for buying a plot of land.

loans.use: To buy more shoes for sale

loans.name: Bajry Group

texts.en:
Bajry Group consists of four women from Hadramout, Yemen. Each member has her own business. They are requesting a group loan of 140,000 YER and they hold each other accountable for repayment. Ebtsam is 38 years old, married, and has one child. She works hard to cover their living expenses. She is a seamstress who is a professional in her field.

She is requesting a loan from AMB for 30,000 YER, which she will use to buy a sewing machine to keep her business running and expand it. She looks forward to making a large profits and accumulating money to open a sewing workshop.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine to keep her business running and expand it.

loans.name: Aziza

texts.en: Aziza is 41 years old and married. Her husband works by selling scrap to support their three children. Besides his business, Aziza and her husband have other small businesses that help in having more family income. They have few number of chickens from which they sell eggs, they have a small farming business to plant and sell vegetables, and they supply one of the universities with bread to its cafeteria by a contract. Now Aziza is applying for a loan to increase the number of chickens she has and plant new types of vegetables for next season.

loans.use: to increase the number of chickens she has and plant new types of vegetables for next season.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es: Víctor tiene 55 años, esta casado con Celia, con ella tiene 4 hijos mayores que viven en la ciudad y estudian en busca de un futuro mejor.Víctor es agricultor y siembra papa, maíz y alverjas en sus tierras; cada día es de sacrificio, porque debe cuidar su chacra aunque no vive con sus hijos les manda dinero a la ciudad y debe trabajar para ayudarlos a salir adelante junto con su esposa, es así que comercializa los productos que cosecha para obtener buenas ganancias económicas , asi como el manifiesta “me alcanza para poder vivir, porque aquí el que no trabaja no come”, y  sabe que se gana más dinero durante la temporada de cosecha, le gusta ser agricultor porque es lo único que aprendió desde niño , además supo poner en practica lo aprendido, para sacar adelante a su familia. Para el futuro tiene muchos planes entre los que se encuentra empezar con la crianza de cuyes, ya que sabe que la carne de estos animales se vende a buen precio además es muy requerida por su exquisitez.Este es el segundo crédito con KIVA, agradece el apoyo recibido, ya que le ayuda a invertir en sus sembríos además se compromete a ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.Víctor, invertirá los S/.3000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos
texts.en:
Victor is 55 years old and is married to Celia. They have four adult children who live in the city and are studying so they can have a better future. Victor is a farmer and grows potatoes, corn and peas on his land. He says that each day is a sacrifice, because he must look after his small farm without his children and send them money in the city. He says he must work along with his wife to help his children get ahead. He sells the products he harvests to obtain good profits. Victor says, “I have enough to live on, because here if you don’t work, you don’t eat”. He also says that he knows that you make more money during the harvest season.

Victor likes being a farmer because it is all he has learned since he was a child. Moreover, he says he learned how to put what he was learning into practice so that he could provide for his family. He has many plans for the future, which include raising guinea pigs, because he says the meat of these animals sells at a good price and is in demand because it is delicious.

This is Victor’s second loan with Kiva. He is grateful for the support he has received, because it has allowed him to invest in his fields. He promises to make his payments on time. He will use the 3000 PEN to buy organic fertilizer for his fields.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer for his fields.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 21-year-old single man. He is one of eight siblings living together. His father has retired from the military department, while his mother works in a school. Mohammad is a fourth year student majoring in Hotel Management. He is applying for a loan to pay for his next semester's fees so he can graduate as soon as possible to help the family by finding a suitable job in his field.

loans.use: to pay for his next semester's fees

loans.name: Maria Josefina

texts.es:
Maria tiene 52 años es casada tiene dos hijos vive con la esposa y con los hijos en Guaranda Provincia de Bolivar.

Se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maiz y papas ademas tiene vacas que producen leche, el dinero lo solicta para la comprar se abonos, fertilizantes y mala plagas, ademas comida y medicina para las vacas.

Con el credito le ayudado a incrementar los ingresos de la familia.

El sueño es comprar un terreno para construir una casa.

en los tiempos libres le gusta descansar.
texts.en:
Maria is 52 years old and married. She has two children and lives with her spouse and children in Guaranda in the Province of Bolivar.

She works in agriculture, planting corn and potatoes. She also has cows that produce milk. The money she is asking for is to buy manure, fertilizer and pesticides, as well as food and medicine for the cows.

The loan will help her to increase the income of her family. Her dream is to buy a piece of land to build a house. In her free time, she likes to relax.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizers and pesticides, as well as food and medicine for the cows.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 26 years old and an industrious gentleman, newly married to Mary. He operates a busy money transfer outlet in Bomet town, in Narok County,  Kenya. 

He learned about KADET LTD from a regular customer of his shop. He has successfully paid his previous loans, and has been issued with a third loan of 80,000 KES, which will enable him expand to the sale of mobile phone accessories.

He will use the proceeds to manage his family's tea plantation. His dream is to attain financial stability.

loans.use: to add more float for the money transfer business and be able to expand to the sale of mobile phone accessories.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Meet 38-year-old Josephine from Paynesville North in Liberia.  Paynesville North has the largest market in Montserrado County.  The area is home to “round time marketers”, traders who travel to the interior to purchase various goods to sell throughout the county. As a result, there is a high concentration of wholesalers in the area who distribute to various markets around Montserrado County, including Monrovia. 

Josephine completed 8th grade. She is single. She describes herself as business minded. She has three children between the ages of 4 years old and 13 years old. They are in school and they all live at home. 

Josephine has a shop that sells fashion clothes. She has been in business for six years and works nine hours per day at her business. With this loan, she will buy blouses, jeans, trousers, dresses, etc., for resale. One of the greatest challenges that she faces is the rainy season. She transports her goods by taxi. She started her business with money from her fiance. She is proud of her business because she gets more profit. Her plan is to own a house. She thanks you in advance for your support!

loans.use: to buy blouses, jeans, trousers, dresses, etc., for resale.

loans.name: Maher

texts.en: Maher is 25 years old. He runs a small store where he sells grocery items to the people in his area. From this, he earns a small amount, which is not enough for his family's sustenance. He is a single man who lives in Taiz, Yemen. He aims to increase his profits, but had inadequate funds to invest in his business. Now he is asking for a loan of 150,000 YER. This will be used to buy canned goods, soft drinks, noodles, and soap to sell in his store. He hopes to have a car to facilitate carrying his goods to his store from the market.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, soft drinks, noodles, and soap to sell in his store.

loans.name: Janisia

texts.en:
Janisia is a 40-year-old widow and a mother of six children between the ages of ten years old and 25 years old. She is a farmer who also operates a food kiosk in the market center.

Janisia learned about KADET LTD from one one her children who is a student in a local institution. She has acquired her second loan after successfully paying off the first one. She will use the loan to buy food items, such as maize flour, wheat flour and peas, for the kiosk.

She will use the proceeds to lease a piece of land, on which she will grow the crops and vegetables she needs for the food stall. Her dream is to own a hotel.

loans.use: to buy food items, such as maize flour, wheat flour and peas, for the kiosk.

loans.name: Ghadeer

texts.en: Ghadeer is a 30-year-old married woman who tries to help her husband in improving their living conditions and add another source of income. She started a home products selling business; most of her products are kitchen wares. Now Ghadeer is applying for a youth loan to add selling decorative pieces and some other home products, such as laundry items and so on.

loans.use: to add selling decorative pieces and some other home products, such as laundry items.

loans.name: Marie Grace

texts.en: Marie Grace is 30 years old. She is married with two children aged between five and seven years. With the loan, she will buy more electronics for resale. The profits from the business will be used to make savings.

loans.use: to buy more electronics for resale.

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans lives in Likoni, south of Mombasa, Kenya. He is a father of an eight-year-old child. He has been selling building blocks for five years now.

Evans knew Milango through friends and he joined. He now seeks a loan of 21,050 Kenya shillings to buy working tools. The challenge he faces in his business is means of transport.

The income received from the loan will pay his child’s school fees.

loans.use: to purchase working tools.

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.en:
Gabriela is a Kubo Financiero client, and this is her story. 

"I am 36 years old and single.  I left school after completing high school and then started working.  I have been selling girls' clothes for the last 8 years and I also teach Sumba.  My parents thought me to be a responsible and hard working person.  The name of my project is 'larger business,' and my slogan is 'more product variety = larger sales.'  I will use this loan to buy inventory, and also I want to start selling vitamin and food supplements.

My biggest accomplishment is being able to build a business; now I want to make it grow and build an apartment in my parents' house."

loans.use: To buy girls' clothes. By having more inventory she will increase her sales.

loans.name: Carlos Ignacio

texts.en:
Carlos is a Kubo Financiero client.  This is his story.

"My name is Carlos, I am 30 years old and have been working as a motorcycle taxi driver for the last 12 years.  I started first with a bicycle and then with hard work and savings I upgraded to a motorcycle.  Now, I have four vehicles.  My slogan is 'always be on time.'  I will use this loan to buy some parts to fix one of my motorcycles.

I consider myself credit worthy because I always honor my commitments and pay on time.  My biggest accomplishments has been upgrading from bicycles to motorcycles and my next goal is to buy a taxi."

loans.use: To buy some parts and fix his motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Arturo Bernardo

texts.en:
Arturo Bernardo is a Kubo Financiero client, and this is his story.

"My name is Arturo and I am 24 years old.  I live with my parents and work with my father buying, fixing and selling used cars.  I come from a great family - my father taught me how to fix cars, and my mother also works extremely hard.  I have two sisters that go to school, but as I am the oldest I have to be a great example to them and work hard.

The name of my project is 'Servicios Beni,' and my slogan is 'engine modifications for competition.'

I will use this loan to buy some spare parts and tools that I need to fix some cars so I can resell them.  I would like to tell you that the business was started by my grandfather.  What we do is buy cars from insurance companies that are in pretty bad shape, fix them and then sell them.  I also work as a mechanic.  Both my father and I manage the business, and I have been working at this job for the last 9 years.  My biggest goal is to start my own car shop."

loans.use: To buy some spare parts to repair cars and then sell them

loans.name: Gustavo Armando

texts.en:
Gustavo Armando is a Kubo Financiero client, and this is his story.

"My name is Gustavo Armando and I am 27 years old.  I am married, have two small kids and we all live in my parents' house.

I have a grocery store that is outside of my in-laws' house.  The name of the store is Abarrotes Paola.  My father-in-law started the business and then sold it to me six years ago when I married his daughter.  I will use this loan to buy more groceries, as I believe that by having more variety, I will be able to increase sales.  I consider myself credit worthy because I always pay my debts on time.  My biggest accomplishment has been having a successful business and being able to buy a car."

loans.use: To buy groceries for his store

loans.name: Picaflor Ii Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PICAFLOR II”  iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Ángela es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de cosméticos, reciclaje, venta de productos AVON, venta de comida, venta de artículos varios, venta de verduras, venta de flores, venta de cordero.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Ángela es integrante, ella indica que hace un ciclo que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una asesora de la institución que fue a su casa a visitarla. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de peluquería; este negocio lo aprendió en un instituto técnico y posteriormente decidió instalar su negocio independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de cepillos, secadora, etc.) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo instalará en su espacio de atención. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es soltera y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las consultas médicas y los ahorros, las capacitaciones y el crédito.

Al grupo acompaña la hija de una señora, ella esta vestida con un chaleco negro
texts.en:
The communal bank "Picaflor II" is entering its fourth loan cycle with Pro Mujer. They are working with one of the organization's regional offices in Villa Exaltación. The group is made up of eight members and is headed by a Board of Directors. Angela is the Secretary of the Board. The members of the communal bank run a variety of businesses, including cosmetics sales, recycling, sales of Avon products, food sales, sales of sundry items, vegetable sales, flower sales and sales of lamb. 

The loan that they will take out will benefit small micro-businesses where Angela is a member. She says that this is her second loan cycle with Pro Mujer. She joined the group at the invitation of a consultant from the institution, who came to visit her at home. Currently, Angela has a hairdressing business. She learned this line of work at a technical school and later decided to open her independent business.

The loan that she is taking out is to increase her working capital (to buy combs, hairdryers, etc.) which she will acquire at fairs in the city of El Alto and later set up in her place of business. This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her household as far as possible, since she is single and has two children.

When asked what she liked about Pro Mujer, she replied that she liked the medical consultations, the savings, the training, and the loans.

The daughter of a woman also appears in the photo of the group. She is wearing a black jacket.

loans.use: to buy combs, hair dryers, etc.

loans.name: Monica

texts.es: La señora Mónica tiene 21 años es casada tiene un hijo de la edad de 5 años, ella se dedica  a la venta de variedad de refrescos tiene su puesto de venta que se encuentra en la zona de plan 3000,  La señora Mónica es una persona muy trabajadora  que con dedicación poco a poco va adquiriendo estabilidad y solvencia y también popularidad por que es muy conocida por sus clientes ya que La señora Mónica les atiende muy amablemente,  con el dinero del crédito comprara un frizer para mantener sus refrescos fríos, la cliente cuenta que con mucho esfuerzo se puede crecer más y así seguir haciéndose de patrimonio para el bienestar de su familia y también personal se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Monica is 21 years old, married and has a five-year old son. 

She works selling a variety of soft drinks. She has her kiosk in the Plan 3000 area. Monica is a very hard-working person who with dedication is acquiring stability and solvency little by little, and also popularity because she is very well-known by her customers as she serves them in a very friendly way. With the loan she will buy a freezer to keep her drinks cold. 

She says that with a lot of effort she can grow more and therefore keep increasing her equity for the wellbeing of her family and also herself. She feels very happy and thankful to the institution for its support.

loans.use: to buy a freezer

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
43-year-old Beatrice is from Paynesville North in Liberia. Paynesville North has the largest market in Montserrado County. The area is home to “round time marketers,” traders that travel to the interior to purchase various goods to sell throughout the county. As a result, there is a high concentration of wholesalers in the area who distribute to various markets around Montserrado County, including Monrovia.
 
She was unfortunately not able to attend school and is married. She describes herself as a hard-working business woman.  She has six children between the ages of 25 and 10. Only four are in school; five of them live at home.
 
Beatrice has a shop that sells rice, fufu, and soup. She has been in business for ten years and works 12 hours per day at her business. With this loan, she will buy more food ingredients such as rice, pepper, fish, meat, etc. One of the greatest challenges that she faces is the rainy season. She transports her goods by taxi. She started her business with money from her fiance. She is proud of her business because she earns more profit. Her plan is to own a house. She thanks you in advance for your support!

loans.use: to buy more ingredients such as rice, pepper, fish, meat, etc.

loans.name: Generación 2006 Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “GENERACIÓN 2006”  iniciará el décimo primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Luisa es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: vendedora de ropa, venta de pantalones, tienda de abarrotes, comercio de añelina, venta de cosméticos, venta de varios, tallado en madera.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Luisa es integrante, ella indica que hace ocho años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una asesora de la institución que fue a su casa a visitarla. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio; este negocio lo instaló al observar las necesidades que tenía en su zona.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de arroz, azúcar, aceite, etc.) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de atención. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones y el crédito.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Generación 2006" is entering its eleventh loan cycle with Pro Mujer. They are working with one of the organization's regional offices in Villa Exaltación. The group is made up of eight members and is headed by a Board of Directors. Luisa is the President of the Board. The members of the communal bank run a variety of businesses, including clothing sales, trouser sales, a grocery store, sales of powdered dyes, cosmetics sales, sales of sundry items, and wood carving.

The loan that they will take out will benefit small micro-businesses where Luisa is a member. She says that this is her eighth loan cycle with Pro Mujer. She joined the group at the invitation of a consultant from the institution, who came to visit her at her home. Currently, Luisa has a business running a neighbourhood convenience store. She began this business when she saw what was needed in her area.

The loan that she is taking out is to increase her stock (to buy rice, sugar, oil, etc.) which she will acquire at fairs in the city of El Alto and later set up in her place of business. This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her household as best as she can, since she is single and has three children.

When asked what she liked about Pro Mujer, she replied that she liked the training and the loans.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, etc.

loans.name: Santos Gabriela

texts.es: Santos Gabriela, mayor de edad con cinco hijos mayores de edad, originaria del municipio de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, Santos es una mujer trabajadora, responsable, ya con muchos esfuerzos logro sacar adelante a sus hijos ahora ella se dedica al comercio  venta de envases de vidrio, los cuales compra en bares y restaurantes luego los lava y estos los vende a una empresa en León, al igual que también realiza ciertas manualidades las cuales las vende en negocios de los mercados, uno de sus sueños es poder seguir mejorando su vivienda, el cual ido reparando poco a poco, el objetivo de este crédito es para la compra de materia primar compra de envases de vidrio, y continuar con su negocio para así tener mayores ingresos, Santos agradece mucho el apoyo que los inversionistas kivas les ofrece a personas de bajos recursos económicos.-
texts.en:
Santos Gabriela, of legal age, has five adult children. She is from the municipality of Chinandega, located in the West of the country. Santos is a hardworking, responsible woman, and with a lot of effort managed to help her children to get ahead. She now works in the business of selling glass bottles, which she buys in bars and restaurants. She then washes them and sells them to a business in León. She also makes some handicrafts, which she sells to businesses in markets.

One of her dreams is to continue making improvements to her home, which she has been repairing bit by bit. This loan will be used to buy primary materials - glass bottles - and to continue her business in order to earn more income. Santos is very grateful for the support that Kiva lenders offer to people with few economic resources.

loans.use: to buy working capital such as glass bottles, among other things.

loans.name: Los Angeles Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado por tres socios exitosos una de ellas es Edimia mujer d36 años de edad, casada, tiene cinco años de estar trabajando con crédito en la institución, su negocio es la venta de refrescos naturales, y pan ambulante en las calles de Masaya, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de azúcar, frambuesa, colorantes, papaya, guayabas para frescos, granadilla, limones, bolsas de libras,etc. María tiene 44 años su negocio es la venta de pan y cosechas de tamarindo y Olivero tiene 35 años de edad y su negocio es la reparación de bicicleta y brinda el servicio  de mantenimiento.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three successful members. One of them is Edimia, a woman who is 36 years old and married. She has been working with loans from the institution for five years. Her business is selling natural soft drinks and bread on the streets of Masaya. 

She will invest this loan in buying sugar, raspberries, dyes, papaya, guavas for soft drinks, passionfruit, lemons, pound bags, etc. 

Maria is 44 years old and her business is selling bread and tamarind crops. Olivero is 35 years old and his business is repairing bicycles, and he offers maintenance services.

loans.use: to buy sugar, raspberries, dyes, papaya, guava, passionfruit, lemons, pound bags, etc.

loans.name: Dorris

texts.en:
This is Dorris from Liberia. She lives in Paynesville North, which is a suburb of the capital city of Monrovia.  Paynesville North has the largest market in Montserrado County. The area is home to “round time marketeers,” traders that travel to the interior to purchase various goods to sell throughout the county. As a result, there is a high concentration of wholesalers in the area who distribute to various markets around Montserrado County, including Monrovia.

Dorris is 47 and married with six children. Her children are between the ages of 32 and 16. One is currently living at home and in school.  

Dorris has owned her own table business selling rice, oil, charcoal, pepper, etc., for the past 10 years. She will use the loan proceeds to purchase goods.  

On average, she works 10 hours at her business. She started her business through her mother's help. She transports her merchandise by taxi. She cites the high price of goods as her biggest challenge. Her favorite part of her business is it keeps her busy. In the future, she would like to own a house.

loans.use: to purchase goods.

loans.name: Los Sauces Group

texts.es: Un grupo conformado por  8   mujeres  emprendedoras   y con mucha creatividad para los negocios. Así son los integrantes del grupo comunal “LOS SAUCES”.  La Sra. Julia   de 65 años de edad casada  y madre de  4  hijos, la Sra. Julia  tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de comida   6  años. La Sra. Julia  ,  ha llegado a fidelizar  a sus clientes   el cual le ha generado ganancias para poder cubrir los gastos de su hogar,  En el futuro le gustaría tener un local propio donde poder vender sus comidas y obtener mayores ganancias económicas. Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá en comprar más productos como (menestras, azúcar , arroz etc)  y así seguir satisfaciendo las necesidades de sus clientes   y así poder salir adelante. A la vez  la Sra. Julia  y todos los integrantes se encuentran  agradecidos   con Kiva  por el préstamo otorgado    y por la confianza que se  les ha sido brindada. La Sra. Julia  es  la primera  de la mano izquierda esta parada chompa negra,  Se despide  Dejando la promesa  que cumplirá todas sus metas propuestas.
texts.en: A group comprised of eight enterprising women who are very creative when it comes to business - such are the members of the "Los Sauces" communal bank. 65-year-old Julia is married and has four children. She has run a small business selling food for six years. Julia has succeeded in gaining the loyalty of her customers, which has resulted in profits that allow her to pay for her household expenses. In the future she would like to own a store of her own where she can sell her food and obtain higher profits. She'll use the requested loan to purchase more merchandise such as stew, sugar, rice, etc. That way she'll continue to meet her customers' needs and she'll be able to get ahead. At the same time, Julia and all the other members are grateful to Kiva for the loan and the trust that has been bestowed upon them. Julia is the one who's standing and wearing a black sweater. She bids farewell and promises that she'll accomplish all the goals she has set for herself.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise for her food stall.

loans.name: Oshalla

texts.en:
Although Oshalla grew out of humble beginnings - fatherless, raised in a public housing project, surrounded by drugs and violence - she was fortunate to have the love and inspiration of her mother, who encouraged Oshalla to dream and instilled in her the desire to “lift as she climbed.” 

She launched Pure Earth Beauty when she saw a need for non-toxic products for the hair and skin, which she coupled with her background in wellness education and yoga instruction. Pure Earth Beauty produces sustainable, 100% plant and earth compounds for coloring and conditioning the hair, scalp and body. The company combines beauty products with educational workshops and retreats specializing in wellness of the mind, body and emotions. Oshalla is committed to sustainability at every phase of her operations, from working with the farmers who grow Pure Earth Color, to the good health of the beauty professionals and customers who use her products. Oshalla believes in the beautification of the mind, the emotions and the body through holistic healing and, through her company, hopes to create a worldwide network that illuminates what all people have in common rather than what sets us apart. The Pure Earth Beauty motto is beauty from the inside out. 

Oshalla needs a business loan to execute her marketing plan and develop sales channels with beauty and salon professionals. She put her life’s savings into her business and was turned down for a bank loan, since she is a start-up company. This loan from Working Solutions will allow Oshalla to invest in website development and social media campaigns to sell inventory, as well as upgrade marketing collateral to promote her workshops and retreats. This business will allow Oshalla to achieve her personal goals of financial security and improving the quality of her life with a reliable income from products she developed and fully believes in.

loans.use: to develop her website and pay for promoting her workshops and retreats

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
This is Beatrice from Liberia. She lives in Paynesville North, which is a suburb of the capital city of Monrovia.  Paynesville North has the largest market in Montserrado County.  The area is home to “round time marketers,” traders that travel to the interior to purchase various goods to sell throughout the county.  As a result, there is a high concentration of wholesalers in the area who distribute to various markets around Montserrado County, including Monrovia.

She is 49 and married with three children. Her children are between the ages of 17 and 2. Two are currently living at home and in school.  Her husband is a driver.

Beatrice has owned her own table business selling lappa (traditional cloths), oil, bread, etc., for the past 10 years. She will use the loan proceeds to purchase goods.

On average, she works 10 hours at her business. She started her business with money from her mother. She transports her merchandise by taxi.  She cites the high price of goods as her biggest challenge. Her favorite part of her business is that it keeps her busy. In the future, she would like to own a house.

loans.use: to purchase goods.

loans.name: Rosales Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ROSALES”  iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Alto Lima, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Maritza es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de camas, venta de mantas, costura de overoles, tejido y venta de mantas, venta de juegos, venta de cerveza, tejido de guantes y gorras.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Maritza es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a su casa a visitarla. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio tejido de mantas; este negocio lo aprendió del apoyo que le realizaba a su madre, porteriormente decide instalar su negocio independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo instalará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es soltera y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gustan las consultas médicas y los ahorros. 

Al grupo acompaña la hermana de una señora, ella esta vestida con una chompa café.
texts.en:
The "Rosales" communal bank will begin its fourth loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Alto Lima regional office. It is comprised of eight members and it's headed by a presiding board in which Maritza serves as a secretary.
